title: Hexo Github Actions
content:
# Github Actions

## ç”Ÿæˆ SSH Key
```ssh
ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "emal@gmail.com"
```

<!--more-->

## æ·»åŠ  Key åˆ° GitHub

### å…¬é’¥

ä»“åº“ --> Secrets --> Actions --> New repository secert

Name: HEXO_DEPLOY_KEY
Value: id_rsa.pub çš„å€¼

## ç§é’¥
ä»“åº“ --> Settings --> Deploy keys --> Add deploy key

Name: HEXO_DEPLOY_PUB
Value: id_rsa  çš„å€¼

# ä½¿ç”¨
```yaml
name: Hexo Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches: 
      - source

jobs:
  build: 
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest 
    name: auto deploy
    
    steps:
    - name: Setup Node.js 12.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@master
      with:
        node-version: "12.x"

    - name: Checkout Repository source branch
      uses: actions/checkout@v2
      with:
        ref: source

    - name: Generate Public Files
      run: |
        npm i
        npm install hexo-cli -g
        hexo clean && hexo generate

    - name: Deploy Hexo
      uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
      with:
        deploy_key: ${{ secrets.HEXO_DEPLOY_KEY }}
        external_repository: ivitan/ivitan.github.io
        publish_branch: master
        publish_dir: ./public
        commit_message: ${{ github.event.head_commit.message }}
        user_name: 'Vitan'
        user_email: 'vitan.me@gmail.com'
    ```

title: Python é¡¹ç›®è°ƒç”¨ Github Actions ä¸­çš„ Secrets
content:
Python é¡¹ç›®è°ƒç”¨ Github Actions ä¸­çš„ Secrets

<!--more-->

## é…ç½® Secret
> è®¾ç½®å¥½åä¸º `mySecret` çš„ Secret 

```yml
name: 'GitHub Actions Demo'
 
on:
  push:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 23 * * *'

jobs:
  Weather-daily:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: 'Checkout'
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: 'Set up Python'
        uses: actions/setup-python@v1
        with:
          python-version: 3.7
      - name: 'Install requirements'
        run: | 
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt
      - name: 'Working'
        env:
          apiID: ${{ secrets.APIID }}
          appSecret: ${{ secrets.APPSECRET }}
          SCKEY: ${{ secrets.SCKEY }}
        run: python Demo.py
```

## Demo

```py
import os

mySecret = os.environ['mySecret']
print(mySecret)
```

title: åˆ©ç”¨ Github Action è‡ªåŠ¨éƒ¨ç½² Hexo
content:
åˆ©ç”¨ Github Action è‡ªåŠ¨éƒ¨ç½² Hexoã€‚
<!--more-->

# Secrets

ä»“åº“ä¸‹ Setting -> Secrets -> New repository secret æ–°å»º Secrets

```sh Secret å
HEXO_DEPLOY_PRI
```

# Actions

Hexo ç›®å½•ä¸‹æ–°å»º .github\workflows\deploy.yml

```yml deploy.yml
# Actions åç§°
name: Hexo Deploy

# ç›‘å¬åˆ†æ”¯æœ‰æä»·æ—¶æ‰§è¡Œ
on:
  push:
    branches: 
      - source

# ç³»ç»Ÿç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡
env:
  TZ: Asia/Shanghai
  GIT_USER: Vitan
  GIT_EMAIL: vitan.me@gmail.com
  DEPLOY_REPO: ivitan/ivitan.github.io
  DEPLOY_BRANCH: master
  THEME_REPO: ivitan/indigo
  THEME_BRANCH: master

# ç³»ç»Ÿç¯å¢ƒ
jobs:
  build:
    name: Setup OS
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest]
        node_version: [12.x]

    steps:
      - name: Checkout Repository source branch
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
        with:
          ref: source

      - name: Checkout Deploy Repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
        with:
          repository: ${{ env.DEPLOY_REPO }}
          ref: ${{ env.DEPLOY_BRANCH }}
          path: .deploy_git
      
      - name: Checkout Theme Repo
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
        with:
          repository: ${{ env.THEME_REPO }}
          ref: ${{ env.THEME_BRANCH }}
          path: themes/indigo

      - name: Setup Node.js ${{ matrix.node_version }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v1
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node_version }}
      
      - name: Setup Deploy Private Key
        env:
          HEXO_DEPLOY_PRI: ${{secrets.HEXO_DEPLOY_PRI}}
        run: |
          mkdir -p ~/.ssh/
          echo "$HEXO_DEPLOY_PRI" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa
          chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa
          ssh-keyscan github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts

      - name: Setup Git Infomation
        run: | 
          git config --global user.name $GIT_USER
          git config --global user.email $GIT_EMAIL

      - name: Setup Hexo Dependencies
        run: |
          sudo timedatectl set-timezone $TZ
          npm install hexo-cli -g
          npm install
          wget https://github.com/ivitan/ivitan.github.io/releases/download/Pin/generator.js -O ./node_modules/hexo-generator-index/lib/generator.js

      - name: Deploy Hexo blog
        run: |
          hexo clean
          hexo generate
          hexo deploy
```

# å­æ¨¡å—

```nginxconf D:\WNMP\Nignx\nginx.cof

```nginxconf D:\WNMP\Nignx\conf\vhost\default.cof
server {

![](https://fastly.jsdelivr.net/gh/ivitan/Picture@master/images/20190721103230.png)

```sh
  #!/bin/bash
  FILE_NAME=/root/my.cnf

  function get_all_segments
  {
      echo "`sed -n '/\[.*\]/p' $FILE_NAME | sed -e 's/\[//g' -e 's/\]//g'`"
  }

  function count_items_in_segment
  {
      items=`sed -n '/\['$1'\]/,/\[.*\]/p' $FILE_NAME | grep -v "^#" | grep -v ^$ | grep -v "\[.*\]"`
      index=0
      for item in $items
      do
          index=`expr $index +1`
      done
      echo $index
  }

  number=0
  for segment in `get_all_segments`
  do
      num=`expr $number + 1`
      items_count=`coubt_items_in_segment $segment`
      echo "$number: $segment $items_count"
  done
```

  function create_random()

title: Terminal Socks5 Proxy
content:
Some Socks5 Proxy setting
<!--more-->
# Git
```bash
git config --global http.proxy socks5://127.0.0.1:1080
git config --global https.proxy socks5://127.0.0.1:1080
git config --global --unset http.proxy
git config --global --unset https.proxy
```

# Curl
```bash .curlrc
echo 'socks5 = "127.0.0.1:1080"' >> ~/.curlrc
```

- ALL_PROXY

```bash
export ALL_PROXY=socks5://127.0.0.1:1080
```

# Wget
```bash EVN Config
xport http_proxy=http://127.0.0.1:1080
xport http_proxy=httpS://127.0.0.1:1080
```

## .wgetrc
```bash ~/.wgetrc
https_proxy = http://127.0.0.1:8087/
http_proxy = http://127.0.0.1:8087/
ftp_proxy = http://127.0.0.1:8087/

# If you do not want to use proxy at all, set this to off.
use_proxy = on
```
-e

```bash
wget -c -r -np -k -L -p -e "http_proxy=http://127.0.0.1:1080" url
```

# Pip
```bash
sudo pacman -S proxychains
```
- vim /etc/proxychains.conf

```bash /etc/proxychains.conf
[ProxyList]
socks5  127.0.0.1 1080
```

- usage

```bash
proxychains pip install <package_name>
```

---
**å‚è€ƒ**

:racehorse: (èµ›é©¬) | `:zap:`
`:racehorse:` | æå‡æ€§èƒ½ :chart_with_upwards_trend: (ä¸Šå‡è¶‹åŠ¿å›¾) | `:chart_with_upwards_trend:` | æ·»åŠ åˆ†ææˆ–è·Ÿè¸ªä»£ç  :rocket: (ç«ç®­) | `:rocket:` | éƒ¨ç½²åŠŸèƒ½ :white_check_mark: (ç™½è‰²å¤é€‰æ¡†) | `:white_check_mark:` | å¢åŠ æµ‹è¯• :memo: (å¤‡å¿˜å½•) | `:memo:` | æ’°å†™æ–‡æ¡£ :hammer: (é”¤å­) | `:hammer:` | é‡å¤§é‡æ„ :art: (è°ƒè‰²æ¿) | `:art:` | æ”¹è¿›ä»£ç ç»“æ„/ä»£ç æ ¼å¼ :fire: (ç«ç„°) | `:fire:` | ç§»é™¤ä»£ç æˆ–æ–‡ä»¶ :pencil2: (é“…ç¬”) | `:pencil2:` | ä¿®å¤ typo :construction: (æ–½å·¥) | `:construction:` | å·¥ä½œè¿›è¡Œä¸­ :construction_worker: (å·¥äºº) | `:construction_worker:` | æ·»åŠ  CI æ„å»ºç³»ç»Ÿ :green_heart: (ç»¿å¿ƒ) | `:green_heart:` | ä¿®å¤ CI æ„å»ºé—®é¢˜ :lock: (é”) | `:lock:` | ä¿®å¤å®‰å…¨é—®é¢˜ :whale: (é²¸é±¼) | `:whale:` | Docker ç›¸å…³å·¥ä½œ :apple: (è‹¹æœ) | `:apple:` | ä¿®å¤ macOS ä¸‹çš„é—®é¢˜ :penguin: (ä¼é¹…) | `:penguin:` | ä¿®å¤ Linux ä¸‹çš„é—®é¢˜ :checkered_flag: (æ——å¸œ) | `:checked_flag:` | ä¿®å¤ Windows ä¸‹çš„é—®é¢˜ --- **Via** - [Git-commit-emoji](https://github.com/liuchengxu/git-commit-emoji-cn/blob/master/README.md) # Emoji-Log ## é…ç½® ```bash .bash/.zshrc #.# Better Git Logs. ### Using EMOJI-LOG (https://github.com/ahmadawais/Emoji-Log). # Git Commit, Add all and Push â€” in one step. function gcap() { git add . && git commit -m "$*" && git push } # NEW. function gnew() { gcap "ğŸ“¦ NEW: $@" } # IMPROVE. function gimp() { gcap "ğŸ‘Œ IMPROVE: $@" } # FIX. function gfix() { gcap "ğŸ› FIX: $@" } # RELEASE. function grlz() { gcap "ğŸš€ RELEASE: $@" } # DOC. function gdoc() { gcap "ğŸ“– DOC: $@" } # TEST. function gtst() { gcap "âœ… TEST: $@" } ``` ## åˆ«ååˆ° ~/.gitconfig ```bash # Git Commit, Add all and Push â€” in one step. cap = "!f() { git add .; git commit -m \"$@\"; git push; }; f" # NEW. new = "!f() { git cap \"ğŸ“¦ NEW: $@\"; }; f" # IMPROVE. imp = "!f() { git cap \"ğŸ‘Œ IMPROVE: $@\"; }; f" # FIX. fix = "!f() { git cap \"ğŸ› FIX: $@\"; }; f" # RELEASE. rlz = "!f() { git cap \"ğŸš€ RELEASE: $@\"; }; f" # DOC. doc = "!f() { git cap \"ğŸ“– DOC: $@\"; }; f" # TEST. tst = "!f() { git cap \"âœ… TEST: $@\"; }; f" ``` # gitmoji-cli ## install ```bash npm i -g gitmoji-cli ``` ## usage ```bash gitmoji --help gitmoji -c ``` --- **Via** - [OpenSource.com](https://opensource.com/article/19/2/emoji-log-git-commit-messages) - [gitmoji-cli](https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji-cli)

def insert_sort(li):
for i in range(1, len(li)): # iæ˜¯æ‘¸åˆ°çš„ç‰Œçš„ä¸‹æ ‡
    tmp = li[i]     # tmpæ˜¯æ‘¸åˆ°ç‰Œçš„å€¼

    while j >= 0 and li[j] > tmp:   # ä¸¤ä¸ªç»ˆæ­¢æ¡ä»¶ï¼šjå°äº0è¡¨ç¤ºtmpæ˜¯æœ€å°çš„ é¡ºåºä¸è¦ä¹±

 ##  å¿«é€Ÿæ’åº
```python
def quick_sort(lists, left, right):
    # å¿«é€Ÿæ’åº
    if left >= right:
        return lists
    key = lists[left]
    low = left
    high = right
    while left < right:
        while left < right and lists[right] >= key:
            right -= 1
        lists[left] = lists[right]
        while left < right and lists[left] <= key:
            left += 1
        lists[right] = lists[left]
    lists[right] = key
    quick_sort(lists, low, left - 1)
    quick_sort(lists, left + 1, high)
    return lists
```
```python
def part(li, left, right):  # åˆ—è¡¨,æœ€å·¦ç´¢å¼•,æœ€å³ç´¢å¼•
    tmp = li[left]  # å…ˆæ‰¾ä¸ªä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡æŠŠç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ å­˜èµ·æ¥
    while left < right:  # å½“æœ€å·¦å°äºæœ€å³
        while left < right and li[right] >= tmp:  # å½“æœ€å·¦<æœ€å³ ä¸” æœ€å³è¾¹çš„å€¼å¤§äºç­‰äºä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡
            right -= 1  # æœ€å³ å¾€å·¦ æŒª 1 ä¸ªå•ä½é•¿åº¦
        li[left] = li[right]  # éƒ½ä¸æ»¡è¶³:æŠŠæŒªå®Œä¹‹åçš„æœ€å³çš„å€¼ èµ‹å€¼ç»™ æœ€å·¦çš„å€¼(å³æœ€å³çš„å€¼å°äºä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡æ—¶,è¿™ä¸ªå€¼æŒªåˆ°å½“å‰æœ€å·¦çš„å€¼)
        while left < right and li[left] <= tmp:  # å½“æœ€å·¦<æœ€å³ ä¸” æœ€å·¦è¾¹çš„å€¼å°äºç­‰äºä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡
            left += 1  # æœ€å·¦ å¾€å³ æŒª 1 ä¸ªå•ä½é•¿åº¦
        li[right] = li[left]  # éƒ½ä¸æ»¡è¶³:æŠŠæŒªå®Œä¹‹åçš„æœ€å·¦çš„å€¼ èµ‹å€¼ç»™ æœ€å³çš„å€¼(å³æœ€å·¦çš„å€¼å¤§äºä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡æ—¶,è¿™ä¸ªå€¼æŒªåˆ°å½“å‰æœ€å³çš„å€¼)
    li[left] = tmp  # å½“å‰æœ€å·¦æœ€å³çš„å€¼ç›¸ç­‰æ—¶,æŠŠè¿™ä¸ªå€¼èµ‹ç»™ä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡
    return left  # è¿”å›å½“å‰ä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡çš„ç´¢å¼•

def quick(li, left, right):
   if left < right:  # å¦‚æœå·¦ç´¢å¼•<å³ç´¢å¼•
       mid = part(li, left, right)  # è°ƒç”¨partè¿›è¡Œåˆ†åŒº è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªç´¢å¼•èµ‹ç»™mid
       quick(li, left, mid - 1)  # é€’å½’è°ƒç”¨quick ç›´åˆ°left=mid-1
       quick(li, mid + 1, right)  # é€’å½’è°ƒç”¨quick ç›´åˆ°mid+1=right

li = list(range(1000))
import random
random.shuffle(li)
print(li)

quick(li, 0, len(li) - 1)
print(li)
```

def sift(li, low, high):
   tmp = li[low]
   i = low
   j = 2 * i + 1
   while j <= high: # é€€å‡ºæ¡ä»¶2ï¼šå½“å‰iä½ç½®æ˜¯å¶å­ç»“ç‚¹ï¼Œjä½ç½®è¶…è¿‡äº†high
       # j æŒ‡å‘æ›´å¤§çš„å­©å­
       if j + 1 <= high and li[j+1] > li[j]:
           j = j + 1 # å¦‚æœå³å­©å­å­˜åœ¨å¹¶ä¸”æ›´å¤§ï¼ŒjæŒ‡å‘å³å­©å­
       if tmp < li[j]:
           li[i] = li[j]
           i = j
           j = 2 * i + 1
       else:       # é€€å‡ºæ¡ä»¶1ï¼štmpçš„å€¼å¤§äºä¸¤ä¸ªå­©å­çš„å€¼
           break
   li[i] = tmp

@cal_time
def heap_sort(li):
   # 1. å»ºå †
   n = len(li)
   for i in range(n//2-1, -1, -1):
       # i æ˜¯å»ºå †æ—¶è¦è°ƒæ•´çš„å­æ ‘çš„æ ¹çš„ä¸‹æ ‡
       sift(li, i, n-1)
   # 2.æŒ¨ä¸ªå‡ºæ•°
   for i in range(n-1, -1, -1): #iè¡¨ç¤ºå½“å‰çš„highå€¼ ä¹Ÿè¡¨ç¤ºæ£‹å­çš„ä½ç½®
       li[i], li[0] = li[0], li[i]
       # ç°åœ¨å †çš„èŒƒå›´ 0~i-1
       sift(li, 0, i-1)
```

def merge(li, low, mid, high):
   i = low
   j = mid + 1
   ltmp = []
   while i <= mid and j <= high:
       if li[i] < li[j]:
           ltmp.append(li[i])
           i += 1
       else:
           ltmp.append(li[j])
           j += 1
   while i <= mid:
       ltmp.append(li[i])
       i += 1
   while j <= high:
       ltmp.append(li[j])
       j += 1
   # for k in range(low, high+1):
   #     li[k] = ltmp[k-low]
   li[low:high+1] = ltmp

def merge_sort(li, low, high):
   if low < high:
       mid = (low + high) // 2
       merge_sort(li, low, mid)
       merge_sort(li, mid+1, high)
       merge(li, low, mid, high)

å…·æœ‰é”®å€¼æ˜ å°„å…³ç³»çš„ä¸€ç»„æ— åºæ•°æ®ç»„åˆï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä¿®æ”¹
- å£°æ˜:
   - dict = {'key1':'value1','key2':'value2'...}

## é›†åˆç±»å‹(Set)
ä¸€ç»„ç‰¹å®šæ•°æ®çš„æ— åºç»„åˆï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰æ•°æ®ä¸ä¼šé‡å¤

title: Regression Validation
content:
å›å½’åˆ†æ
<!--more-->
# å¯¼å…¥æ•°æ®
```python
import pandas 
df = pandas.read_csv('house-prices.csv')
df.head()
```

# one-hot å¤„ç†
```python
#å¯¹Brickä¸Neighborhoodä¸¤åˆ—æ•°æ®è¿›è¡Œone-hotå¤„ç†
house =  pandas.concat([df,pandas.get_dummies(df['Brick']),pandas.get_dummies(df['Neighborhood'])] ,axis=1)
#åˆ é™¤Noåˆ—
del house['No']
#åˆ é™¤Weståˆ—
del house['West']
#åˆ é™¤Brickåˆ—
del house['Brick']
#åˆ é™¤Neighborhoodåˆ—
del house['Neighborhood']
#åˆ é™¤Homeåˆ—
del house['Home']
house.head()
```
# statsmodels.api
```python
#Xä¸ºhouseçš„'SqFt', 'Bedrooms', 'Bathrooms', 'Offers', 'Yes', 'East', 'North'åˆ—
X = house[['SqFt', 'Bedrooms', 'Bathrooms', 'Offers', 'Yes', 'East', 'North']]
#Yä¸ºhouseçš„Priceåˆ—çš„values
Y = house['Price']
```

```python
import numpy.core.multiarray
from pandas.core import datetools
#å¯¼å…¥statsmodels.apié‡Œé¢çš„smï¼Œç”¨äºè¯„ä¼°æ¨¡å‹
import statsmodels.api as sm
#åˆ©ç”¨sm.add_constantä¸ºXå¢åŠ ä¸€åˆ—åä¸ºconst,å€¼ä¸º1çš„æ•°æ®
X2 = sm.add_constant(X)
#è°ƒç”¨smçš„OLSå‡½æ•°å¯¹Y,X2è¿›è¡Œæ¨¡å‹åˆ›å»º
est = sm.OLS(Y,X2)
#è°ƒç”¨estçš„fitå‡½æ•°åˆ›å»ºå›å½’ç»“æœ
est2 = est.fit()
#è¾“å‡ºæ‰“å°est2çš„æ¦‚è¦ä¿¡æ¯
print(est2.summary())
est2.aic
```

## æœ€ä¼˜ç»„åˆ
```python
predictorcols = ['SqFt', 'Bedrooms', 'Bathrooms', 'Offers', 'Yes', 'East', 'North']
import itertools
for i in range(1,len(predictorcols)+1):
    for variables in itertools.combinations(predictorcols,i):
        print(variables)
```
```python
import itertools#å¯¼å…¥itertoolsåº“
#åˆ›å»ºå­—å…¸AICs ï¼Œç”¨äºä¿å­˜æ¯ä¸ªåˆ—åç»„åˆçš„aicç»“æœ
AICs = {}
#forå¾ªç¯ï¼Œå¾ªç¯å˜é‡iä»1åˆ°predictorcolsåˆ—è¡¨çš„é•¿åº¦åŠ 1
for i in range(1,len(predictorcols)+1):
    #å†æ¬¡forå¾ªç¯ï¼Œå¾ªç¯å˜é‡varçš„èŒƒå›´ä¸ºpredictorcolsçš„å„ç§iä¸ªå…ƒç´ ç»„åˆé›†åˆitertools.combinations(predictorcols,i)
    for var in itertools.combinations(predictorcols,i):   
        #predictorsä¸ºæ•°æ®æ¡†Xé‡Œçš„varåˆ—çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œè®°å¾—è¦å…ˆå°†varè½¬æ¢æˆlist
        predictors  = X[list(var)]
        #åˆ©ç”¨sm.add_constantä¸ºpredictorså¢åŠ ä¸€åˆ—åä¸ºconst,å€¼ä¸º1çš„æ•°æ®
        predictors2 =  sm.add_constant(predictors)
        #è°ƒç”¨smçš„OLSå‡½æ•°å¯¹y,predictors2è¿›è¡Œæ¨¡å‹åˆ›å»º
        est = sm.OLS(Y,predictors2)
        #è°ƒç”¨estçš„fitå‡½æ•°åˆ›å»ºå›å½’ç»“æœ
        res = est.fit()
        print(res.aic) # æ¯ç§ç»„åˆçš„aicå€¼
    #å°†res.aicçš„ç»“æœèµ‹å€¼ç»™ AICsçš„æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªvar   
        AICs[var] =  res.aic
```
```python
#å¯¼å…¥collectionsçš„Counter
from collections import Counter
#è°ƒç”¨Counterï¼Œå¯¹AICsè¿›è¡Œé™åºæ’åº
c = Counter(AICs)
#è°ƒç”¨æ’åºåçš„cå€’æ•°10ä¸ªæ•°æ®å¯¹è±¡
c.most_common()[::-10]
```

# Spiders
```python
    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
    from scrapy import Spider,Request
    from anjuke.items import AnjukeItem

    class AnjukehouseSpider(Spider):
        name = 'anjukeHouse'
        allowed_domains = ['anjuke.com']
        start_urls = ['https://guangzhou.anjuke.com/sale/p1-rd1/#filtersort']

        def parse(self, response):
            # æ‰€æœ‰æˆ¿å­URL
            urls = response.xpath('//div[@class="house-title"]/a/@href').extract()
            for url in urls:
                yield Request(url,callback=self.parse_detail)

            # ä¸‹ä¸€é¡µ
            next = response.xpath('//*[@id="content"]/div[4]/div[7]/a[7]/@href').extract()
            if next:
                next = response.urljoin(next[0])
                yield Request(next,callback=self.parse)

        def parse_detail(self,response):
            item = AnjukeItem()
            item['date'] = response.xpath('//span[@class="house-encode"]/text()').extract()[0].split()
            item['tittle'] = response.xpath('//h3[@class="long-title"]/text()').extract()
            item['price'] = response.xpath('//span[@class="light info-tag"]/em/text()').extract_first().split()

            houseInfo = response.xpath('//div[@class="houseInfo-content"]/text()').extract()
            item['huxing'] = houseInfo[2].strip().replace("\n","").replace("\t","").split()
            item['area'] = houseInfo[7].strip().split()
            item['built'] = houseInfo[9].strip().replace("\n", "").replace("\t", "").split()
            item['chaoxiang'] = houseInfo[10].strip().split()
            item['leixing'] = houseInfo[-8].strip().split()
            item['louceng'] = houseInfo[-7].strip().split()
            item['zhuangxiu'] = houseInfo[-6].strip().split()
            print(item)
        return item
```

## pipelines
```python
    import csv
    import os

    class Pipeline_ToCSV(object):

        def __init__(self):
            self.csvwriter = csv.writer(open('anjuke.csv', 'w'), delimiter=',')
            self.csvwriter.writerow(['date','tittle', 'price', 'huxing', 'area','built','chaoxiang','leibie','loucheng','zhuangxiu'])

        def process_item(self, item, ampa):
            rows = zip(item['date'],item['tittle'], item['price'],item['huxing'],item['area'],item['built'],item['chaoxiang'],item['leixing'],item['louceng'],item['zhuangxiu'])

            for row in rows:
                self.csvwriter.writerow(row)

            return item
```

# Selenium
```python
    #!/usr/bin/env python
    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
    # @Time    : 18-12-28 ä¸‹åˆ6:48
    # @Author  : Vitan
    # @File    : anjuke.py

    from selenium import webdriver
    from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
    from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
    from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
    from bs4 import  BeautifulSoup
    import pandas
    import time,random

    broswer = webdriver.Chrome()
    wait = WebDriverWait(broswer,10)
    houseInfo = []
    def get_urls():
        page_urls = []
        star_url = 'https://guangzhou.anjuke.com/sale/p'
        for i in range(1,51):
            url = star_url+str(i)
            page_urls.append(url)
        return page_urls

    def HouseUrl(url):
        time.sleep(random.random()*10)
        broswer.get(url)
        wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.curr')))
        urls = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.houseListTitle') # a æ ‡ç­¾
        house_urls = []
        for a in urls:
            urls = a.get_attribute('href')
            house_urls.append(urls)
        return house_urls

    def get_detail(url):
        time.sleep(random.random()*10)
        broswer.get(url)
        wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.houseInfoBox')))
        info = {}
        # info['æ ‡é¢˜'] = broswer.find_element_by_css_selector('.long-title').get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['æ€»ä»·'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.basic-info span')[0].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['æˆ·å‹'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.basic-info span')[1].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['é¢ç§¯'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.basic-info span')[2].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['å•ä»·'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.houseInfo-content')[2].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['æœå‘'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.houseInfo-content')[7].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['æœˆä¾›'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.houseInfo-content')[8].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['æ¥¼å±‚'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.houseInfo-content')[-7].get_attribute('textContent')
        # info['è£…ä¿®'] = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.houseInfo-content')[-6].get_attribute('textContent')
        html = broswer.page_source
        soup = BeautifulSoup(html,'lxml')
        info['æ ‡é¢˜'] = soup.select('.long-title')[0].text
        info['æ€»ä»·'] = soup.select('.basic-info span')[0].text
        info['æˆ·å‹'] = soup.select('.basic-info span')[1].text
        info['é¢ç§¯'] = soup.select('.basic-info span')[2].text
        info['å•ä»·'] = soup.select('.houseInfo-content')[2].text
        info['æœå‘'] = soup.select('.houseInfo-content')[7].text
        info['æœˆä¾›'] = soup.select('.houseInfo-content')[8].text
        info['æ¥¼å±‚'] = soup.select('.houseInfo-content')[-7].text
        info['è£…ä¿®'] = soup.select('.houseInfo-content')[-6].text
        k = ['æ ‡é¢˜','æ€»ä»·','æˆ·å‹','é¢ç§¯','å•ä»·','æœå‘','æœˆä¾›','æ¥¼å±‚','è£…ä¿®']
        info_adj = dict(zip(k,list(info.values())))
        houseInfo.append(info_adj)
        print(houseInfo)
        return houseInfo

    def save_to_csv(houseInfo):
        df = pandas.DataFrame(houseInfo)
        df.to_csv('maoming.csv')

    def main():
        page_urls = get_urls()
        for url in page_urls:
            house_urls = HouseUrl(url)
            for url in house_urls:
                houseInfo=get_detail(url)
                save_to_csv(houseInfo)

    if __name__ == '__main__':
        main()
```

# Imputing Missing Value
```python
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame([\
             ['frank', 'M',    np.nan], \
             [np.nan , np.nan, np.nan], \
             ['tom'  , 'M',    35], \
             ['ted'  , 'M',    33], \
             ['jean' , np.nan, 21], \
             ['lisa' , 'F',    20]])
df.columns = ['name', 'gender', 'age']
```

- åˆ é™¤

```python
#åˆ é™¤dfå…·æœ‰Nanå€¼çš„è¡Œ

df.dropna(how='all')

#åˆ é™¤dfç©ºå€¼è¶…è¿‡2ä¸ªçš„è¡Œè®°å½•

#åˆ é™¤dfçš„ageåˆ—

df.dropna(axis=1,how='all')

- å¢åŠ 

```python
#åœ¨dfä¸­å¢åŠ ä¸€æ–°åˆ—employeeï¼Œä¸”å€¼ä¸ºç©ºï¼ˆnp.nanï¼‰

- å¡«è¡¥

```python

#å°†dfçš„ageåˆ—çš„å‡å€¼å¡«å…¥è¯¥åˆ—å€¼ä¸ºç©ºçš„å•å…ƒæ ¼
df['age'].fillna(df['age'].mean())

#å°†dfçš„ageåˆ—çš„ç©ºå•å…ƒæ ¼ï¼ŒæŒ‰æ€§åˆ«å¡«å…¥è¯¥ç±»æ€§åˆ«çš„å¹³å‡å¹´é¾„å€¼
df['age'].fillna(df.groupby('gender')['age'].transform('mean'))

    #å¯¹ç‰©ä¸šè´¹ä¸ºç©ºçš„å•å…ƒæ ¼ï¼Œå¡«è¡¥ä¸º0

    df[df['ç¸½åƒ¹'].isnull()]

    (df['ç¸½åƒ¹'] / df['å»ºç­‘é¢ç§¯']).mean()

    df['ç¸½åƒ¹'] = df['ç¸½åƒ¹'].fillna((df['ç¸½åƒ¹'] / df['å»ºç­‘é¢ç§¯']).mean()* df['å»ºç­‘é¢ç§¯'])

    df['ç¸½åƒ¹'].isnull().sum()

title: Scrapy
content:
Scrapy å‘½ä»¤ # å®‰è£… ```bash sudo pip install scrapy ``` # åˆ›å»º/è¿è¡Œ ## åˆ›å»ºé¡¹ç›® ```python scrapy startproject projectName ``` ## é¡¹ç›® tree ```bash â”œâ”€â”€ scrapy.cfg é¡¹ç›®çš„é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ â””â”€â”€ zhihu è¯¥é¡¹ç›®çš„pythonæ¨¡å—ã€‚ä¹‹åæ‚¨å°†åœ¨æ­¤åŠ å…¥ä»£ç  â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py â”œâ”€â”€ items.py é¡¹ç›®ä¸­çš„ item æ–‡ä»¶. â”œâ”€â”€ middlewares.py â”œâ”€â”€ pipelines.py â”œâ”€â”€ __pycache__ â”œâ”€â”€ settings.py é¡¹ç›®çš„è®¾ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ â””â”€â”€ spiders æ”¾ç½® spider ä»£ç çš„ç›®å½• â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py â””â”€â”€ __pycache__ ``` ## åˆ›å»ºæ–°çš„ spider ```python scrapy genspider mydomain mydomain.com ``` ## è¿è¡Œ ```python scrapy crawl mydomain ``` # é¡¹ç›®æ“ä½œ ```python scrapy crawl zhihu # æ‰§è¡Œé¡¹ç›® scrapy check [-l] # æ£€æŸ¥é”™è¯¯ scrapy list # è¿”å› spider åç§° scrapy edit # åœ¨å‘½ä»¤è¡Œç¼–è¾‘ scrapy fetch url # ä¸‹è½½ç½‘é¡µæºç  scrapy fetch --nolog url # æ— æ—¥å¿— scrapy fetch --nolog --no-redirect url # é‡å®šå‘ scrapy view url # ä¸‹è½½ç½‘é¡µåæµè§ˆå™¨æ‰“å¼€ scrapy shell # äº¤äº’æ¨¡å¼ scrapy crawl user -o items.json # ä¿å­˜æ•°æ®ï¼ˆsv,xml,json,jsonlines,pickle,marshalï¼‰ ``` # é€‰æ‹©å™¨ ç½‘é¡µæºç  ```html Example website
Name: My image 1
Name: My image 2
Name: My image 3
Name: My image 4
Name: My image 5
``` äº¤äº’æ¨¡å¼ä¸‹ ```python crapy shell https://doc.scrapy.org/en/latest/_static/selectors-sample1.html ``` 1. æ„å»ºä¸€ä¸ªé€‰æ‹©å™¨æ¥é€‰æ‹©titleæ ‡ç­¾å†…çš„æ–‡æœ¬ ```python # xpath response.selector.xpath('//title/text()') # selector å¯çœç•¥ response.xpath('//title/text()') # css response.css('title::text') ``` æå–æ–‡æœ¬æ•°æ®ï¼Œå¿…é¡»è°ƒç”¨selector .extract() æ–¹æ³• ```python response.xpath('//title/text()').extract() # æ‰€æœ‰ response.css('title::text').extract_first() # ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ª ``` 2. è·å–å±æ€§ ```python response.xpath('//a/Ahref').extract() response.css('a::attr(href)').extract() response.css('img').xpath('@src').extract() response.xpath('//div[@id="images"]/a/text()').extract_first() ``` default é»˜è®¤è¿”å›å€¼ä½œä¸ºå‚æ•° ```python response.xpath('//div[@id="not-exists"]/text()').extract_first(default='not-found') ``` 3. è·å–æ–‡æœ¬å†…å®¹ ```python response.xpath('//a/text()').extract() response.css('a::text()').estract() ``` 4. æ¨¡ç³ŠæŸ¥æ‰¾(å±æ€§ååŒ…å«) ```python # æŸ¥æ‰¾ä¸‰æ˜ŸåŒ…å«image response.xpath('//a[contains(@href,"image")]/@href').extract() response.css('a[href* = image]::attr(href)').extract() # a æ ‡ç­¾é‡Œé¢çš„imageé‡Œçš„srcå±æ€§ response.xpath("//a[contains(@href,'image')]/img/@src").extract() response.css('a[href* = image] img::attr(src)').extract() ``` ## åµŒå¥—é€‰æ‹©å™¨ 1. xpath,css ```python links = response.xpath('//a[contains(@href, "image")]') links.extract() for index, link in enumerate(links): args = (index, link.xpath('@href').extract(), link.xpath('img/@src').extract()) print 'Link number %d points to url %s and image %s' % args ``` ## å…·æœ‰æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼çš„é€‰æ‹©å™¨ ```python response.css('a::text').re('Name\:(.*)') # è¿”å›çš„æ˜¯åˆ—è¡¨ response.css('a::text').re_first('Name\:(.*)') # ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå€¼ response.css('a::text').re_first('Name\:(.*)').strip() # å»ç©ºæ ¼ # æå–å›¾åƒåç§° response.xpath('//a[contains(@href, "image")]/text()').re(r'Name:\s*(.*)') # æå–ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªåŒ¹é…çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸² response.xpath('//a[contains(@href, "image")]/text()').re_first(r'Name:\s*(.*)') ``` # å®šä¹‰ Item Item æ˜¯ä¿å­˜çˆ¬å–åˆ°çš„æ•°æ®çš„å®¹å™¨ï¼›å…¶ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³•å’Œpythonå­—å…¸ç±»ä¼¼. - ç¼–è¾‘ tutorial ç›®å½•ä¸­çš„ items.py æ–‡ä»¶: ```python import scrapy class DmozItem(scrapy.Item): title = scrapy.Field() link = scrapy.Field() desc = scrapy.Field() ``` --- **å®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£** - [è‹±æ–‡](https://docs.scrapy.org/en/latest/) - [ä¸­æ–‡](https://scrapy-chs.readthedocs.io/zh_CN/1.0/index.html)

title: Python SQL
content:
Python SQL æ“ä½œ
<!--more-->
# MonngoDB
## è¿æ¥
```python
    import pymongo

    # æ™®é€šè¿æ¥
    client = MongoClient('localhost', 27017)
    # client = MongoClient('mongodb://localhost:27017/')
    
    # å¯†ç è¿æ¥
    client = MongoClient('mongodb://username:password@localhost:27017/dbname')
    db = client.mydatabase
    # db = client['mydatabase']
```

## å¢åˆ æŸ¥æ”¹

- å¢(insert)

```python
    # å¢åŠ ä¸€æ¡è®°å½•
    person = {'name': 'zone','sex':'boy'}
    person_id = test.insert_one(person).inserted_id
    print(person_id)
    
    # æ‰¹é‡æ’å…¥
    persons = [{'name': 'zone', 'sex': 'boy'}, {'name': 'zone1', 'sex': 'boy1'}]
    result = test.insert_many(persons)
    print(result.inserted_ids)
```

- åˆ (delete)

```python
    import pymongo

    myclient = pymongo.MongoClient("mongodb://localhost:27017/")
    mydb = myclient["mydatabase"]
    mycol = mydb["customers"]

    # åˆ é™¤åœ°å€ä¸ºâ€œMountain 21â€çš„æ–‡æ¡£ï¼š
    myquery = { "address": "Mountain 21" }
    mycol.delete_one(myquery)

    # delete_many() åˆ é™¤å¤šä¸ª
    myquery = { "address": {"$regex": "^S"} }
    x = mycol.delete_many(myquery)
    print(x.deleted_count, " documents deleted.")
```
 
```python
    # åˆ é™¤å•æ¡è®°å½•
    result1 = test.delete_one({'name': 'zone'})
    pprint.pprint(result1)

    # æ‰¹é‡åˆ é™¤
    result1 = test.delete_many({'name': 'zone'})
    pprint.pprint(result1)
```

- æ”¹(update)

```python
    # Valley 345â€æ›´æ”¹ä¸ºâ€œCanyon 123â€ 
    myquery = { "address": "Valley 345" }
    newvalues = { "$set": { "address": "Canyon 123" } }

    mycol.update_one(myquery, newvalues)

    #print "customers" after the update:
    for x in mycol.find():
        print(x)

    # update_many() æ›´æ–°å¤šä¸ª
    myquery = { "address": { "$regex": "^S" } }
    newvalues = { "$set": { "name": "Minnie" } }

    x = mycol.update_many(myquery, newvalues)

    print(x.modified_count, "documents updated.")
```

```python
    # æ›´æ–°å•æ¡è®°å½•
    res = test.update_one({'name': 'zone'}, {'$set': {'sex': 'girl girl'}})
    print(res.matched_count)

    # æ›´æ–°å¤šæ¡è®°å½•
    test.update_many({'name': 'zone'}, {'$set': {'sex': 'girl girl'}})
```

- æŸ¥(Querry)

```python
    import pymongo

    myclient = pymongo.MongoClient("mongodb://localhost:27017/")
    mydb = myclient["mydatabase"]
    mycol = mydb["customers"]

    # æŸ¥æ‰¾åœ°å€ä»¥å­—æ¯â€œSâ€æˆ–æ›´é«˜å¼€å¤´çš„æ–‡æ¡£ï¼š
    myquery = { "address": { "$gt": "S" } }

    mydoc = mycol.find(myquery)

    for x in mydoc:
        print(x)
    

    # æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼è¿‡æ»¤
    myquery = { "address": { "$regex": "^S" } }

    mydoc = mycol.find(myquery)

    for x in mydoc:
        print(x)
```

```python
    import pprint

    # æŸ¥æ‰¾å¤šæ¡è®°å½•
    pprint.pprint(test.find())

    # æ·»åŠ æŸ¥æ‰¾æ¡ä»¶
    pprint.pprint(test.find({"sex": "boy"}).sort("name"))
```

# æ’åº

- sort()æ–¹æ³•

```python
results = collection.find().sort('name', pymongo.ASCENDING)
print([result['name'] for result in results])
```

## ç¤ºä¾‹
```python
    client = pymongo.MongoClient('localhost')
    b = client['MaFengWoView']

    def save_to_mongo(view):
    if db['MaFengWoView'].insert_one(view):
        print('Saving to MongoDB',view)

    return False

     save_to_mongo(view)
```

# MySQL
## è¿æ¥åˆ›å»º

- åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªåä¸ºâ€œcustomersâ€çš„è¡¨

```python
    import mysql.connector

    mydb = mysql.connector.connect(
    host="localhost",
    user="yourusername",
    passwd="yourpassword",
    database="mydatabase"
    )

    mycursor = mydb.cursor()

    mycursor.execute("CREATE TABLE customers (name VARCHAR(255), address VARCHAR(255))")
```

- æ£€æŸ¥è¡¨æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨

```python
    mycursor = mydb.cursor()

    mycursor.execute("SHOW TABLES")

    for x in mycursor:
        print(x)
```

- åˆ›å»ºè¡¨æ—¶åˆ›å»ºä¸»é”®(å­˜åœ¨ç”¨ALTER TABLE)

```python
    import mysql.connector

    mydb = mysql.connector.connect(
    host="localhost",
    user="yourusername",
    passwd="yourpassword",
    database="mydatabase"
    )

    mycursor = mydb.cursor()

    mycursor.execute("CREATE TABLE customers (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), address VARCHAR(255))")
```

# æ’å…¥

- å•è¡Œ

```python
    mycursor = mydb.cursor()

    sql = "INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES (%s, %s)"
    val = ("John", "Highway 21")
    mycursor.execute(sql, val)

    mydb.commit()

    print(mycursor.rowcount, "record inserted.")
```

- å¤šè¡Œ

```python
    mycursor = mydb.cursor()

    sql = "INSERT INTO customers (name, address) VALUES (%s, %s)"
    val = [
        ('Peter', 'Lowstreet 4'),
        ('Amy', 'Apple st 652'),
        ('Hannah', 'Mountain 21'),
        ('Michael', 'Valley 345'),
        ('Sandy', 'Ocean blvd 2'),

        ('Ben', 'Park Lane 38'),

```

title: Qunar
content: Selenium Qunar.com # ä¿®æ”¹ç‰ˆ ```python from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC from selenium.common.exceptions import WebDriverException,TimeoutException from pyquery.pyquery import PyQuery as pq from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time import pymongo driver = webdriver.Chrome() wait = WebDriverWait(driver,10) client = pymongo.MongoClient('localhost') db = client['Qunar'] def lastPage(url): driver.get(url) wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.next'))) html = driver.page_source soup = BeautifulSoup(html,'lxml') total = int(soup.select('.pager a')[-2].text) return total def search_next(page): next = driver.find_element_by_css_selector('.next') wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.next'))) next.click() wait.until(EC.text_to_be_present_in_element((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pager em'),str(page))) time.sleep(1) def get_url(): doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('.sight_item_caption') li = [] for box in doc.items(): url = 'http://piao.qunar.com'+str(box.find('.name').attr('href')) li.append(url) return li def get_comment_last(url): # è¯„è®ºæ€»é¡µæ•° driver.get(url) wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item'))) doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('#pageContainer') li = [i.text() for i in doc.find('.mp-pager-item').items()] return int(li[-2]) def get_comment_next(page): try: next = driver.find_element_by_css_selector('.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item') wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item'))) next.click() wait.until(EC.text_to_be_present_in_element((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.mp-pager em'),str(page))) time.sleep(1) except TimeoutException: get_comment_next(page) except WebDriverException: get_comment_next(page) def get_comments(): doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('.mp-comments-list') for item in doc.find('.mp-comments-item').items(): usr = item.find('.mp-comments-username').text() date = item.find('.mp-comments-time').text() comment = item.find('.mp-comments-desc').text() view = { 'user':usr, 'date':date, 'comment':comment } save_to_mongo(view) def save_to_mongo(view): if db['comment'].insert_one(view): print('Saving to MongoDB',view) return True return False def main(): url = 'http://piao.qunar.com/ticket/list_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD.html#from=home_remen&in_track=qunar_djmp_gnmdd_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD' total = lastPage(url) all_url = get_url() for i in range(2,total+1): search_next(i) all_url.extend(get_url()) for url in all_url: total = get_comment_last(url) get_comments() for i in range(2,total+1): get_comment_next(i) get_comments() if __name__ == '__main__': main() ``` # è‡ªåŠ¨è·å–é¡µæ•° ```python #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # @Time : 18-11-20 ä¸Šåˆ11:53 # @Author : Vitan # @File : Qunar.py from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC from selenium.common.exceptions import WebDriverException,NoSuchElementException,TimeoutException from pyquery.pyquery import PyQuery as pq import pymongo import re driver = webdriver.Chrome() wait = WebDriverWait(driver,10) client = pymongo.MongoClient('localhost') db = client['Qunar'] def lastPage(): try: url = 'http://piao.qunar.com/ticket/list_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD.html?keyword=%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD&page=1#from=home_remen&in_track=qunar_djmp_gnmdd_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD' driver.get(url) doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = str(doc.find('.pager')) pattern = re.compile('(\d+)', re.S) result = re.match(pattern, doc) total = int(result.group(1)) print(total) return total except TimeoutException: return total def get_url(): doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('.sight_item_caption') li = [] for box in doc.items(): url = 'http://piao.qunar.com'+str(box.find('.name').attr('href')) li.append(url) return li def get_comment_last(): # è¯„è®ºæ€»é¡µæ•° doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('#pageContainer') li = [i.text() for i in doc.find('.mp-pager-item').items()] return int(li[-2]) def get_comment_next(i): try: next = driver.find_element_by_css_selector('.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item') next.click() wait.until(EC.text_to_be_present_in_element((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pager em'),str(i))) except TimeoutException: get_comment_next(i) except WebDriverException: get_comment_next(i) def get_page_comments(): doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('.mp-comments-list') for item in doc.find('.mp-comments-item').items(): usr = item.find('.mp-comments-username').text() date = item.find('.mp-comments-time').text() comment = item.find('.mp-comments-desc').text() view = { 'user':usr, 'date':date, 'comment':comment } print(view) save_to_mongo(view) def get_all_url(): # æ‰€æœ‰æ™¯ç‚¹ Url driver.execute_script('window.open()') # æ‰“å¼€æ–°çš„é€‰é¡¹å¡ driver.switch_to.window(driver.window_handles[1]) total = lastPage() driver.switch_to.window(driver.window_handles[0]) all_url = [] for i in range(1, total - 60): url = 'http://piao.qunar.com/ticket/list_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD.html?keyword=%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD&page=' + str( i) + '#from=home_remen&in_track=qunar_djmp_gnmdd_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD' driver.get(url) wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.next'))) all_url.extend(get_url()) print(all_url) return all_url def get_allcomment_url(): all_url = get_all_url() # æ™¯ç‚¹æ‰€æœ‰è¯„è®º for url in all_url: driver.get(url) wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, '.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item'))) total = get_comment_last() # è¯„è®ºé¡µæ•° get_page_comments() print(total) for i in range(2, total + 1): get_comment_next(i) get_page_comments() def save_to_mongo(view): if db['comment'].insert_one(view): print('Saving to MongoDB',view) return True return False def main(): get_allcomment_url() get_page_comments() if __name__ == '__main__': main() ``` # æ‰‹åŠ¨è®¾ç½®é¡µæ•° ```Python #!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # @Time : 18-11-20 ä¸Šåˆ11:53 # @Author : Vitan # @File : Qunar.py from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC from selenium.common.exceptions import WebDriverException,NoSuchElementException,TimeoutException from pyquery.pyquery import PyQuery as pq import pymongo import re driver = webdriver.Chrome() wait = WebDriverWait(driver,10) client = pymongo.MongoClient('localhost') db = client['Qunar'] def get_url(): doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('.sight_item_caption') li = [] for box in doc.items(): url = 'http://piao.qunar.com'+str(box.find('.name').attr('href')) li.append(url) return li def get_comment_last(): # è¯„è®ºæ€»é¡µæ•° doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('#pageContainer') li = [i.text() for i in doc.find('.mp-pager-item').items()] return int(li[-2]) def get_comment_next(i): try: next = driver.find_element_by_css_selector('.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item') next.click() wait.until(EC.text_to_be_present_in_element((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pager em'),str(i))) except TimeoutException: get_comment_next(i) except WebDriverException: get_comment_next(i) def get_page_comments(): doc = pq(driver.page_source) doc = doc.find('.mp-comments-list') for item in doc.find('.mp-comments-item').items(): usr = item.find('.mp-comments-username').text() date = item.find('.mp-comments-time').text() comment = item.find('.mp-comments-desc').text() view = { 'user':usr, 'date':date, 'comment':comment } print(view) save_to_mongo(view) def save_to_mongo(view): if db['comment'].insert_one(view): print('Saving to MongoDB',view) return True return False def main(): # æ‰€æœ‰æ™¯ç‚¹ Url all_url = [] for i in range(1,2): url = 'http://piao.qunar.com/ticket/list_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD.html?keyword=%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD&page='+ str(i) +'#from=home_remen&in_track=qunar_djmp_gnmdd_%E6%88%90%E9%83%BD' driver.get(url) wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.next'))) all_url.extend(get_url()) # æ™¯ç‚¹æ‰€æœ‰è¯„è®ºUrl for url in all_url: driver.get(url) wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.mp-pager-next.mp-pager-item'))) total = get_comment_last() # è¯„è®ºé¡µæ•° print(total) get_page_comments() for i in range(2,total+1): get_comment_next(i) get_page_comments() if __name__ == '__main__': main() ```

## åˆ—æ·»åŠ 
```python
import pandas as pd

d = {'one' : pd.Series([1, 2, 3], index=['a', 'b', 'c']),
        'two' : pd.Series([1, 2, 3, 4], index=['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'])}

df = pd.DataFrame(d)

# Adding a new column to an existing DataFrame object with column label by passing new series

print ("Adding a new column by passing as Series:")
df['three']=pd.Series([10,20,30],index=['a','b','c'])
print(df)

print ("Adding a new column using the existing columns in DataFrame:")
df['four']=df['one']+df['three']

print(df)
```

## åˆ—åˆ é™¤
```python
# Using the previous DataFrame, we will delete a column
# using del function
import pandas as pd

d = {'one' : pd.Series([1, 2, 3], index=['a', 'b', 'c']), 
  'two' : pd.Series([1, 2, 3, 4], index=['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']), 
  'three' : pd.Series([10,20,30], index=['a','b','c'])}

df = pd.DataFrame(d)
print ("Our dataframe is:")
print(df)

# using del function
print ("Deleting the first column using DEL function:")
del df['one']
print(df)

# using pop function
print ("Deleting another column using POP function:")
df.pop('two')
print(df)
```

title: Selenium é©¬èœ‚çªè¯„è®º
content:
Selenium é©¬èœ‚çªè¯„è®ºå†…å®¹

```python
    #!/usr/bin/env python
    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
    # @Time    : 18-11-13 ä¸Šåˆ11:56
    # @Author  : Vitan
    # @File    : SeleniumMaFengWo.py

    from selenium import webdriver
    from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
    from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
    from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
    from selenium.common.exceptions import NoSuchAttributeException
    from selenium.common.exceptions import TimeoutException
    from pyquery.pyquery import PyQuery as pq
    import pymongo

    broswer = webdriver.Firefox()
    wait = WebDriverWait(broswer,10)

    client = pymongo.MongoClient('localhost')
    db = client['MaFengWoView']

    def search_first(url):
        try:
            broswer.get(url)
            wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pi.pg-last')))
            total = int(broswer.find_element_by_css_selector('.pi.pg-last').get_attribute('data-page'))
            print(total)
            place()
            return total
        except TimeoutException:
            return search_first(url)

    def search_next(page):
        try:
            next = broswer.find_element_by_css_selector('.pi.pg-next')
            next.click()
            wait.until(EC.text_to_be_present_in_element((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pg-current'),str(page)))
            place()
        except NoSuchAttributeException:
            search_next(page)

    def place():
        anchors = broswer.find_elements_by_css_selector('.scenic-list.clearfix li a')
        for a in anchors:
            url = a.get_attribute('href')
            print(url)
            total = view_first(url)
            for page in range(2,total+1):
                view_next(page)

        # html = broswer.page_source
        # doc = pq(html)
        # anchors = doc('.scenic-list.clearfix li a')
        # for a in anchors.items():
        #     url = a.attr('href')
        #     print(url)

    def view_first(url):
        try:
            broswer.get(url)
            wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pi.pg-last')))
            total = int(broswer.find_element_by_css_selector('.pi.pg-last').get_attribute('data-page'))
            get_view()
            return total
        except TimeoutException:
            return view_first(url)

    def view_next(page):
        try:
            next = broswer.find_element_by_css_selector('.pi.pg-next')
            next.click()
            wait.until(EC.text_to_be_present_in_element((By.CSS_SELECTOR,'.pg-current'),str(page)))
            get_view()
        except NoSuchAttributeException:
            view_next(page)

    def get_view():
        html = broswer.page_source
        doc = pq(html)
        lis = doc('.rev-item.comment-item.clearfix')
        for li in lis.items():
            view = {
                'name':li.find('.name').text().strip(),
                'level':li.find('.level').text().strip(),
                'txt':li.find('.rev-txt').text().strip()
            }
            save_to_mongo(view)

    def save_to_mongo(view):
        if db['MaFengWoView'].insert_one(view):
            print('Saving to MongoDB',view)
            return True
        return False

    def main():
        url = 'http://www.mafengwo.cn/jd/10088/gonglve.html'
        total = search_first(url)
        for page in range(2,total+1):
            search_next(page)
        #     print('Clicking',page,'é¡µ')
        # url = 'http://www.mafengwo.cn/poi/449.html'
        # total = view_first(url)
        # for page in range(2,total+1):
        #     view_next(page)

    if __name__=='__main__':
        main()
```

```python
        #!/usr/bin/env python
        # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
        # @Time    : 18-11-12 10:10
        # @Author  : Vitan

        from sklearn.datasets import load_sample_image
        import matplotlib.image as img
        from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
        import numpy as np
        from matplotlib import pyplot as plt

        # å¯¼å…¥å›¾ç‰‡
        picture = load_sample_image('china.jpg') # å†…ç½®
        pic2 = img.imread('v.jpg') # å¤–éƒ¨

        # æ ¹æ®å›¾ç‰‡çš„åˆ†è¾¨ç‡ï¼Œå¯é€‚å½“é™ä½åˆ†è¾¨ç‡ã€‚
        image = picture[::3,::3]# æ¨ªçºµæ¯ä¸‰ä¸ªç‚¹å»ä¸€ä¸ªé¢œè‰²å€¼
        plt.imshow(image)
        img.imsave('pure.jpg',image)
        plt.show()

        # å†ç”¨kå‡å€¼èšç±»ç®—æ³•ï¼Œå°†å›¾ç‰‡ä¸­æ‰€æœ‰çš„é¢œè‰²å€¼åšèšç±»ã€‚
        X = image.reshape(-1,3) #reshapeä¸ºä¸€ç»´
        mod = KMeans(n_clusters = 64)
        labels = mod.fit_predict(X)  #æ¯ä¸ªç‚¹çš„é¢œè‰²åˆ†ç±»ï¼Œ0-63
        colors = mod.cluster_centers_  #64ä¸ªèšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼Œé¢œè‰²å€¼

        # è¿˜åŸé¢œè‰²ï¼Œç»´æ•°ï¼Œæ•°æ®ç±»å‹
        new_img = colors[labels]
        new_img = new_img.reshape(image.shape)
        new_img = new_img.astype(np.uint8)
        print(new_img)

        # æ˜¾ç¤ºå‹ç¼©å›¾ç‰‡
        plt.imshow(new_img)
        img.imsave('E://zip.jpg',new_img)
        plt.show()
```

```python
    # æ­£å¤ªåˆ†å¸ƒå›¾

     Â  Â  Â  Â color = 'steelblue', # æŒ‡å®šå¡«å……è‰²

    # è®¾ç½®åæ ‡è½´æ ‡ç­¾å’Œæ ‡é¢˜

```python
    # å¯¼å…¥æ¨¡å—
    import pandas as pd
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

    # è®¾ç½®ç»˜å›¾é£æ ¼
    plt.style.use('ggplot')
    # è®¾ç½®ä¸­æ–‡ç¼–ç å’Œè´Ÿå·çš„æ­£å¸¸æ˜¾ç¤º
    plt.rcParams['font.sans-serif'] = 'SimHei'
    plt.rcParams['axes.unicode_minus'] = False

    # è¯»å–éœ€è¦ç»˜å›¾çš„æ•°æ®
    article_reading = pd.read_excel('wechart.xlsx')
    # å–å‡º8æœˆä»½è‡³9æœˆ28æ—¥çš„æ•°æ®
    sub_data = article_reading.loc[article_reading.date >= '2017-08-01' ,:]

    # è®¾ç½®å›¾æ¡†çš„å¤§å°
    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
    # ç»˜å›¾
    plt.plot(sub_data.date, # xè½´æ•°æ®
     Â  Â  Â  Â  sub_data.article_reading_cnts, # yè½´æ•°æ®
     Â  Â  Â  Â  linestyle = '-', # æŠ˜çº¿ç±»å‹
     Â  Â  Â  Â  linewidth = 2, # æŠ˜çº¿å®½åº¦
     Â  Â  Â  Â  color = 'steelblue', # æŠ˜çº¿é¢œè‰²
     Â  Â  Â  Â  marker = 'o', # ç‚¹çš„å½¢çŠ¶
     Â  Â  Â  Â  markersize = 6, # ç‚¹çš„å¤§å°
     Â  Â  Â  Â  markeredgecolor='black', # ç‚¹çš„è¾¹æ¡†è‰²
     Â  Â  Â  Â  markerfacecolor='brown') # ç‚¹çš„å¡«å……è‰²

    # æ·»åŠ æ ‡é¢˜å’Œåæ ‡è½´æ ‡ç­¾
    plt.title('å…¬ä¼—å·æ¯å¤©é˜…è¯»äººæ•°è¶‹åŠ¿å›¾')
    plt.xlabel('æ—¥æœŸ')
    plt.ylabel('äººæ•°')

    # å‰”é™¤å›¾æ¡†ä¸Šè¾¹ç•Œå’Œå³è¾¹ç•Œçš„åˆ»åº¦
    plt.tick_params(top = 'off', right = 'off')

    # ä¸ºäº†é¿å…xè½´æ—¥æœŸåˆ»åº¦æ ‡ç­¾çš„é‡å ï¼Œè®¾ç½®xè½´åˆ»åº¦è‡ªåŠ¨å±•ç°ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”45åº¦å€¾æ–œ
    fig.autofmt_xdate(rotation = 45)

    # æ˜¾ç¤ºå›¾å½¢
    plt.show()
```
- ç”±äºxè½´æ˜¯æ—¥æœŸå‹æ•°æ®ï¼Œå½“æ•°æ®é‡ä¸€å¤šçš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œå°±ä¼šå¯¼è‡´åˆ»åº¦æ ‡ç­¾çš„é‡å æˆ–æ‹¥æŒ¤ï¼Œä¸ºäº†é˜²æ­¢é‡å çš„äº§ç”Ÿï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦è®©æ—¥æœŸå‹çš„xè½´åˆ»åº¦æ ‡ç­¾è‡ªåŠ¨å±•ç°ï¼Œä»è€Œé¿å…é‡å çš„ç°è±¡

# matplotlib(é›·è¾¾å›¾)
```Python
    # å¯¼å…¥ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹æ¨¡å—
    import numpy as np
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

    # ä¸­æ–‡å’Œè´Ÿå·çš„æ­£å¸¸æ˜¾ç¤º
    plt.rcParams['font.sans-serif'] = 'SimHei'
    plt.rcParams['axes.unicode_minus'] = False

    # ä½¿ç”¨ggplotçš„ç»˜å›¾é£æ ¼
    plt.style.use('ggplot')

    # æ„é€ æ•°æ®
    values = [3.2,2.1,3.5,2.8,3]
    feature = ['ä¸ªäººèƒ½åŠ›','QCçŸ¥è¯†','è§£å†³é—®é¢˜èƒ½åŠ›','æœåŠ¡è´¨é‡æ„è¯†','å›¢é˜Ÿç²¾ç¥']

    N = len(values)
    # è®¾ç½®é›·è¾¾å›¾çš„è§’åº¦ï¼Œç”¨äºå¹³åˆ†åˆ‡å¼€ä¸€ä¸ªåœ†é¢
    angles=np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, N, endpoint=False)

    # ä¸ºäº†ä½¿é›·è¾¾å›¾ä¸€åœˆå°é—­èµ·æ¥ï¼Œéœ€è¦ä¸‹é¢çš„æ­¥éª¤
    values=np.concatenate((values,[values[0]]))
    angles=np.concatenate((angles,[angles[0]]))

    # ç»˜å›¾
    fig=plt.figure()
    # è¿™é‡Œä¸€å®šè¦è®¾ç½®ä¸ºæåæ ‡æ ¼å¼
    ax = fig.add_subplot(111, polar=True)
    # ç»˜åˆ¶æŠ˜çº¿å›¾
    ax.plot(angles, values, 'o-', linewidth=2)
    # å¡«å……é¢œè‰²
    ax.fill(angles, values, alpha=0.25)
    # æ·»åŠ æ¯ä¸ªç‰¹å¾çš„æ ‡ç­¾
    ax.set_thetagrids(angles * 180/np.pi, feature)
    # è®¾ç½®é›·è¾¾å›¾çš„èŒƒå›´
    ax.set_ylim(0,5)
    # æ·»åŠ æ ‡é¢˜
    plt.title('æ´»åŠ¨å‰åå‘˜å·¥çŠ¶æ€è¡¨ç°')
    # æ·»åŠ ç½‘æ ¼çº¿
    ax.grid(True)
    # æ˜¾ç¤ºå›¾å½¢
    plt.show()
```

# å¤šæ¡çº¿çš„é›·è¾¾å›¾
```python
    # å¯¼å…¥ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹æ¨¡å—
    import numpy as np
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

    # ä¸­æ–‡å’Œè´Ÿå·çš„æ­£å¸¸æ˜¾ç¤º
    plt.rcParams['font.sans-serif'] = 'SimHei'
    plt.rcParams['axes.unicode_minus'] = False

    # ä½¿ç”¨ggplotçš„ç»˜å›¾é£æ ¼
    plt.style.use('ggplot')

    # æ„é€ æ•°æ®
    values = [3.2,2.1,3.5,2.8,3]
    values2 = [4,4.1,4.5,4,4.1]
    feature = ['ä¸ªäººèƒ½åŠ›','QCçŸ¥è¯†','è§£å†³é—®é¢˜èƒ½åŠ›','æœåŠ¡è´¨é‡æ„è¯†','å›¢é˜Ÿç²¾ç¥']

    N = len(values)
    # è®¾ç½®é›·è¾¾å›¾çš„è§’åº¦ï¼Œç”¨äºå¹³åˆ†åˆ‡å¼€ä¸€ä¸ªåœ†é¢
    angles=np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, N, endpoint=False)
    # ä¸ºäº†ä½¿é›·è¾¾å›¾ä¸€åœˆå°é—­èµ·æ¥ï¼Œéœ€è¦ä¸‹é¢çš„æ­¥éª¤
    values=np.concatenate((values,[values[0]]))
    values2=np.concatenate((values2,[values2[0]]))
    angles=np.concatenate((angles,[angles[0]]))

    # ç»˜å›¾
    fig=plt.figure()
    ax = fig.add_subplot(111, polar=True)
    # ç»˜åˆ¶æŠ˜çº¿å›¾
    ax.plot(angles, values, 'o-', linewidth=2, label = 'æ´»åŠ¨å‰')
    # å¡«å……é¢œè‰²
    ax.fill(angles, values, alpha=0.25)
    # ç»˜åˆ¶ç¬¬äºŒæ¡æŠ˜çº¿å›¾
    ax.plot(angles, values2, 'o-', linewidth=2, label = 'æ´»åŠ¨å')
    ax.fill(angles, values2, alpha=0.25)

    # æ·»åŠ æ¯ä¸ªç‰¹å¾çš„æ ‡ç­¾
    ax.set_thetagrids(angles * 180/np.pi, feature)
    # è®¾ç½®é›·è¾¾å›¾çš„èŒƒå›´
    ax.set_ylim(0,5)
    # æ·»åŠ æ ‡é¢˜
    plt.title('æ´»åŠ¨å‰åå‘˜å·¥çŠ¶æ€è¡¨ç°')

    # æ·»åŠ ç½‘æ ¼çº¿
    ax.grid(True)
    # è®¾ç½®å›¾ä¾‹
    plt.legend(loc = 'best')
    # æ˜¾ç¤ºå›¾å½¢
    plt.show()

# PySpider
```Python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- encoding: utf-8 -*-
# Created on 2018-11-06 11:52:31
# Project: PySpider_MaFengWo

from pyspider.libs.base_handler import *
import json
from pyspider.libs.utils import md5string
import re
from fake_useragent import UserAgent

default_headers = {
           'Accept':'application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01',
           'Accept-Encoding':'gzip, deflate',
           'Accept-Language':'zh-CN,zh;q=0.9,en-US;q=0.8,en;q=0.7',
           'Connection':'keep-alive',
           'Content-Length':68,
           'Content-Type':'application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8',
           'Connection':'keep-alive',
           'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests':1,
           'User-Agent':'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/60.0.3100.0 Safari/537.36',
           'X-Requested-With':'XMLHttpRequest',
        }

class Handler(BaseHandler):
    crawl_config = {
        'headers':default_headers,
        'timeout':300,
        'proxy':'192.168.1.1:8080',
    }

    @every(minutes=24 * 60)
    def on_start(self):
        url = 'http://www.mafengwo.cn/jd/10088/gonglve.html'
        self.crawl(url,callback=self.get_index,fetch_type='js')

    def get_taskid(self, task):
        return md5string(task['url']+json.dumps(task['fetch'].get('data', '')))

    def get_index(self,response):
        url = 'http://www.mafengwo.cn/ajax/router.php'
        total = int(response.doc('.pi.pg-last').attr('data-page'))
        for i in range(1,total+1):
            data = {
                    'sAct':'KMdd_StructWebAjax|GetPoisByTag',
                    'iMddid':'10088',
                    ' iTagId':0,
                    'iPage':i
             }
            self.crawl(url,method='POST',data=data,callback=self.index_page)

    # æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªå›è°ƒdetail_pageçš„ä»»åŠ¡æœ‰æ•ˆæœŸæ˜¯10å¤©
    @config(age=10 * 24 * 60 * 60)
    def index_page(self, response):
        print(response.text)
        result = response.text.replace('\\','')
        print(result)
        pattern = re.compile('<a href="(.*?)" target=')
        urls = re.findall(pattern,result)
        for url in urls:
            mainurl = 'https://www.mafengwo.cn'
            self.crawl(mainurl + url, callback=self.detail_page,fetch_type='js')

    # æ•°å­—è¶Šå¤§ä¼˜å…ˆçº§è¶Šé«˜
    @config(priority=2)
    def detail_page(self, response):
        return {
        "name": response.doc('h1').text(),
        "location":response.doc('.mhd > p').text(),
        "price":response.doc('.mod-detail dd > div').text(),
        "phone":response.doc('.tel > .content').text(),
        "visittime":response.doc('.item-time > .content').text(),
        "website":response.doc('.content > a').text(),

        }
```

Python Kmeans

# KMeans

- K - meansæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåå¤è¿­ä»£çš„è¿‡ç¨‹ï¼Œç®—æ³•åˆ†ä¸ºå››ä¸ªæ­¥éª¤ï¼š

```Python
    #!/usr/bin/env python
    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
    # @Time    : 18-11-5 ä¸‹åˆ12:10
    # @Author  : Vitan
    # @File    : Kmeans.py

    from sklearn.datasets import load_iris
    import numpy as np
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
    from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
    x = np.random.randint(1,50,[20,1])

    # å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªç»™å®šå½¢çŠ¶å’Œç±»å‹çš„ç”¨0å¡«å……çš„æ•°ç»„y
    y = np.zeros(20)
    k = 3 # åˆ†æˆ3ç±»

    # 1. é€‰å–æ•°æ®ç©ºé—´ä¸­çš„Kä¸ªå¯¹è±¡ä½œä¸ºåˆå§‹ä¸­å¿ƒï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªå¯¹è±¡ä»£è¡¨ä¸€ä¸ªèšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼›
    def initcenter(x,k):
        return x[:k]

    # 2. å¯¹äºæ ·æœ¬ä¸­çš„æ•°æ®å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œæ ¹æ®å®ƒä»¬ä¸è¿™äº›èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒçš„æ¬§æ°è·ç¦»ï¼Œ
    # æŒ‰è·ç¦»æœ€è¿‘çš„å‡†åˆ™å°†å®ƒä»¬åˆ†åˆ°è·ç¦»å®ƒä»¬æœ€è¿‘çš„èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼ˆæœ€ç›¸ä¼¼ï¼‰æ‰€å¯¹åº”çš„ç±»ï¼›

    # è®¡ç®—æ¬§æ°è·ç¦»
    def nearest(kc,i):
        d = abs(kc -i) # asb() å–ç»å¯¹å€¼
        # è¿”å›ä¸èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒæœ€å°è·ç¦»æ‰€åœ¨ç±»åˆ«çš„ç´¢å¼•å·
        w = np.where(d == np.min(d))
        return w[0][0]

    # æŒ‰è·ç¦»æœ€è¿‘çš„å‡†åˆ™å°†å®ƒä»¬åˆ†åˆ°è·ç¦»å®ƒä»¬æœ€è¿‘çš„èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼ˆæœ€ç›¸ä¼¼ï¼‰æ‰€å¯¹åº”çš„ç±»
    def xclassify(x, y, kc):
        # å¯¹æ•°ç»„çš„æ¯ä¸ªå€¼è¿›è¡Œåˆ†ç±»ï¼Œshape[0]è¯»å–çŸ©é˜µç¬¬ä¸€ç»´åº¦çš„é•¿åº¦
        for i in range(x.shape[0]):
            y[i] = nearest(kc, x[i])
            return y
    kc = initcenter(x,k)
    y = xclassify(x,y,kc)
    print(kc,y)

    # 3. æ›´æ–°èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼šå°†æ¯ä¸ªç±»åˆ«ä¸­æ‰€æœ‰å¯¹è±¡æ‰€å¯¹åº”çš„å‡å€¼ä½œä¸ºè¯¥ç±»åˆ«çš„èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼Œè®¡ç®—ç›®æ ‡å‡½æ•°çš„å€¼ï¼›
    def kcmean(x,y,kc,k):
        l = list(kc)
        flag = False
        for c in range(k):
            m = np.where(y ==0)
            n = np.mean(x[m])
            if l[c] != n:
                l[c] = n
                flag = True
                print(l,flag)
        return (np.array(l),flag)

    # 4 . åˆ¤æ–­èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒå’Œç›®æ ‡å‡½æ•°çš„å€¼æ˜¯å¦å‘ç”Ÿæ”¹å˜ï¼Œè‹¥ä¸å˜ï¼Œåˆ™è¾“å‡ºç»“æœï¼Œè‹¥æ”¹å˜ï¼Œåˆ™è¿”å›2ï¼‰
    kc = initcenter(x,k)
    flag = True # èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒå‘ç”Ÿæ”¹å˜
    print(x,y,kc,flag)
    while flag:
        y = xclassify(x,y,kc)
        kc,flag = kcmean(x,y,kc,k)
    print(y,kc)
```

# é¸¢å°¾èŠ±

- é¸¢å°¾èŠ±èŠ±ç“£é•¿åº¦æ•°æ®åšèšç±»å¹¶ç”¨æ•£ç‚¹å›¾æ˜¾ç¤º

```python
    iris = load_iris()
    data = iris.data
    iris_length = data[:,2]

    x = np.array(iris_length)
    y = np.zeros(x.shape[0]) # x.shape[0] åªè¯»å–xçš„ç¬¬ä¸€ç»´åº¦é•¿åº¦

    # é€‰å–æ•°æ®ç©ºé—´ä¸­çš„Kä¸ªå¯¹è±¡ä½œä¸ºåˆå§‹ä¸­å¿ƒï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªå¯¹è±¡ä»£è¡¨ä¸€ä¸ªèšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼›
    kc = initcenter(x,3)

    # æŒ‰è·ç¦»æœ€è¿‘çš„å‡†åˆ™å°†å®ƒä»¬åˆ†åˆ°è·ç¦»å®ƒä»¬æœ€è¿‘çš„èšç±»ä¸­å¿ƒï¼ˆæœ€ç›¸ä¼¼ï¼‰æ‰€å¯¹åº”çš„ç±»
    flag = True
    while flag:
        y = xclassify(x,y,kc)
        kc,flag = kcmean(x,y,kc,3)
    print(kc,flag)

    plt.scatter(iris_length, iris_length, c = y,cmap = 'rainbow')
    plt.savefig('èŠ±ç“£é•¿åº¦æ•£ç‚¹å›¾.png')
    plt.show()
```

- ç”¨sklearn.cluster.KMeansï¼ŒèŠ±ç“£é•¿åº¦æ•°æ®åšèšç±»

```python
    iris_length = data[:, 2:3]
    kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters = 4 )
    result = kmeans.fit(iris_length)
    kc1 = result.cluster_centers_
    y_kmeans = kmeans.predict(iris_length) # é¢„æµ‹æ¯ä¸ªæ ·æœ¬çš„èšç±»ç´¢å¼•

    plt.scatter(iris_length,np.linspace(1,150,150),c = y_kmeans,marker = 'D',cmap = 'rainbow')
    plt.savefig('sklearn.cluster.KMeansé•¿åº¦.png')
    plt.show()
```

- é¸¢å°¾èŠ±å®Œæ•´æ•°æ®åšèšç±»

```python
    k_means1 = KMeans(n_clusters = 4)
    result1 = k_means1.fit(data)

# æ‰“å° index

# å­—å…¸çš„è¯»å–
å¯¹å­—å…¸çš„è®¿é—®å’Œè¯»å–ï¼Œè¯»å–çš„å­—å…¸ key ä¸ºç©ºï¼Œéœ€è¦ä¸€ä¸ªç¼ºçœå€¼

- ä¸€èˆ¬æ–¹æ³•

```Python

- å·§å¦™åœ°åˆ©ç”¨å­—å…¸çš„ get çš„æ–¹æ³•ã€‚è‹¥å­—å…¸æ²¡æœ‰ Susan çš„ keyï¼Œåˆ™ç”¨ unknow æ¥è¡¨ç¤ºç¼ºçœå€¼ã€‚

# å¾ªç¯æŸ¥æ‰¾
åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªå¤§çš„å¾ªç¯ä¸­ä½œæœç´¢ï¼Œå¦‚åœ¨æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­æœç´¢å…³é”®å­—ï¼Œä»æ–‡ä»¶ååˆ—è¡¨ä¸­æŸ¥æ‰¾ç‰¹æ®Šçš„æ–‡ä»¶å

- ä¸€èˆ¬æ–¹æ³•

```Python
    target_letter = 'd'

    found = False

            print('Found')

```

```Python
    target_letter = 'd'

    for letter in letters:

            print('found')

```

    iris_set = []

    for i in range(0, 150):
        # ç±»åˆ«ä¸º0çš„ä¸º setosa èŠ±ï¼Œç”Ÿæˆä¸€æ¡setosaç±»çš„é¸¢å°¾èŠ±æ•°æ®
        if data.target[i] == 0:

        # ç±»åˆ«ä¸º1çš„å³ä¸º versicolorï¼Œç”Ÿæˆä¸€æ¡versicolorç±»çš„é¸¢å°¾èŠ±æ•°æ®
        elif data.target[i] == 1:

## np.random
- ç”¨ np.random.normal() äº§ç”Ÿä¸€ä¸ªæ­£æ€åˆ†å¸ƒçš„éšæœºæ•°ç»„ï¼Œå¹¶æ˜¾ç¤ºå‡ºæ¥ã€‚

- np.random.randn()äº§ç”Ÿä¸€ä¸ªæ­£æ€åˆ†å¸ƒçš„éšæœºæ•°ç»„ï¼Œå¹¶æ˜¾ç¤ºå‡ºæ¥ã€‚

title: çŒ«çœ¼ç”µå½± Top100
content:
çŒ«çœ¼ç”µå½± Top100 # æ€è·¯ 1. è·å–å•é¡µç½‘é¡µæºä»£ç å¹¶è¿”å›æºä»£ç  2. è§£æå•é¡µç½‘é¡µæºä»£ç ï¼Œæå– titleã€actorã€timeã€score ç­‰æ•°æ®å¹¶å­˜å‚¨ä¸ºç”Ÿæˆå™¨ 3. å°†ç”Ÿæˆå™¨é‡Œæ¯ä¸€éƒ¨ç”µå½±çš„æ•°æ®å†™å…¥txtæ–‡æ¡£ä¸­ 4. ç ”ç©¶ç¬¬ 1-10 é¡µ url çš„è§„å¾‹ï¼Œæ„å»º urlï¼Œè°ƒç”¨ 1ã€2ã€3 æ­¥éª¤ # æ­¥éª¤ è·å–å•é¡µç½‘é¡µæºä»£ç å¹¶è¿”å›æºä»£ç  ```Python import requests import re import json from requests.exceptions import RequestException def get_one_page(url): headers = {'user-agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.67 Safari/537.36'} try: response = requests.get(url,headers = headers) if response.status_code == 200: html = response.text return html return None except RequestException: return None ``` - æ‰“å°ç¬¬ä¸€é¡µæºç  ```Python print(get_one_page('http://maoyan.com/board/4')) ``` è§£æå•é¡µç½‘é¡µæºä»£ç ï¼Œæå–titleã€actorã€timeã€scoreæ•°æ®å¹¶å­˜å‚¨ä¸ºç”Ÿæˆå™¨ ```Python def parse_one_page(html): pattern = re.compile('
.*?board-index.*?>(\d+)' + '.*?.*?star">(.*?)

' + '.*?releasetime">(.*?)

.*?integer">(.*?)' + '<.*?fraction">(.*?)',re.S) movies = re.findall(pattern,html) for item in movies: yield{ 'æ’å':item[0], 'ç”µå½±å':item[1], 'ä¸»æ¼”':item[2].strip()[3:], 'ä¸Šæ˜ æ—¶é—´':item[3][5:], 'è¯„åˆ†':item[4]+item[5] } ``` > æ³¨æ„ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œéœ€è¦ç”¨ yieldï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯returnã€‚yieldå‡½æ•°è¿”å›çš„æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç”Ÿæˆå™¨ï¼ˆä¸€ç§ç‰¹æ®Šçš„è¿­ä»£å™¨ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ç”¨forå¾ªç¯è¿›è¡Œéå†ï¼‰ > å¦‚æœç”¨returnï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆåœ¨ç¬¬ä¸€è½®å¾ªç¯ç»“æŸå°±ä¼šè·³å‡ºï¼Œåªèƒ½è·å–åˆ°ä¸€éƒ¨å½±ç‰‡çš„ä¿¡æ¯ å°†ç”Ÿæˆå™¨æ•°æ®å†™å…¥ txt æ–‡æ¡£ ```Python def write_to_txt(content): # é‡‡ç”¨ append è¿½åŠ æ¨¡å¼ï¼Œå­—ç¬¦é›†ä¸ºutf8 with open('movies.txt','a',encoding='utf8') as f: # é‡‡ç”¨jsonçš„dumpsæ–¹æ³•æ¥åˆå§‹åŒ–å­—ç¬¦ä¸² f.write(json.dumps(content,ensure_ascii=False) + '\n') f.close() ``` ç ”ç©¶ç¬¬1-10é¡µ ```Python # ç¬¬1-10é¡µurl for i in range(0,10): url = 'https://maoyan.com/board/4?offset=' + str(i * 10) # æ„å»º urlï¼Œè°ƒç”¨1ã€2ã€3æ­¥éª¤ html = get_one_page(url) movies= parse_one_page(html) for item in movies: write_to_txt(item) ``` ## å¤šçº¿ç¨‹ä¿æŒä¸º txt - ç¬¬ä¸€æ­¥ ```Python import requests import re import json from multiprocessing import Pool from requests.exceptions import RequestException def get_one_page(url): headers = {'user-agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.67 Safari/537.36'} try: response = requests.get(url,headers = headers) if response.status_code == 200: html = response.text return html return None except RequestException: return None ``` - ç¬¬äºŒæ­¥ ```Python def main(offset): url = 'http://maoyan.com/board/4?offset=' + str(offset) html = get_one_page(url) for item in parse_one_page(html): print(item) write_to_txt(item) if __name__ == '__main__': pool = Pool() # å¤šçº¿ç¨‹ pool.map(main, [i*10 for i in range(10)]) pool.close() pool.join() ``` # ä¿æŒä¸º CSV ## å•çº¿ç¨‹ ```Python import requests import re import json import pandas from requests.exceptions import RequestException def get_one_page(url): headers = {'user-agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.67 Safari/537.36'} response = requests.get(url,headers = headers) html = response.text return html def parse_one_page(html): pageary = [] pattern = re.compile('
.*?board-index.*?>(\d+)' + '.*?.*?star">(.*?)

' + '.*?releasetime">(.*?)

.*?integer">(.*?)' + '<.*?fraction">(.*?)',re.S) movies = re.findall(pattern,html) for item in movies: dict = { 'ç”µå½±å':item[0], 'ä¸»æ¼”':item[1].strip()[3:], 'ä¸Šæ˜ æ—¶é—´':item[2][5:], 'è¯„åˆ†':item[3]+item[4] } pageary.append(dict) return pageary ary = [] for i in range(0,10): url = 'https://maoyan.com/board/4?offset=' + str(i * 10) html = get_one_page(url) pageary = parse_one_page(html) ary = ary + pageary df = pandas.DataFrame(ary) df.to_csv('movies.csv') ``` ## å¤šçº¿ç¨‹ ```Python import requests import re import json import pandas from multiprocessing import Pool from requests.exceptions import RequestException def get_one_page(url): headers = {'user-agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.67 Safari/537.36'} try: response = requests.get(url,headers = headers) if response.status_code == 200: html = response.text return html return None except RequestException: return None def parse_one_page(html): pageary = [] pattern = re.compile('
.*?board-index.*?>(\d+)' + '.*?.*?star">(.*?)

' + '.*?releasetime">(.*?)

.*?integer">(.*?)' + '<.*?fraction">(.*?)',re.S) movies = re.findall(pattern,html) for item in movies: dict = { 'æ’å':item[0], 'ç”µå½±å':item[1], 'ä¸»æ¼”':item[2].strip()[3:], 'ä¸Šæ˜ æ—¶é—´':item[3][5:], 'è¯„åˆ†':item[4]+item[5] } pageary.append(dict) return pageary def write_to_csv(pageary): ary = [] ary = ary + pageary df = pandas.DataFrame(ary) df.to_csv('movies.csv') def main(offset): url = 'https://maoyan.com/board/4?offset=' + str(offset) pageary = parse_one_page(html) write_to_csv(ary) if __name__ == '__main__': pool = Pool() pool.map(main, [i*10 for i in range(10)]) pool.close() pool.join() ```

# DateTime
## è·å–å½“å‰ DateTime
```Python
from datetime timport datetime
datetime.datetime.now()
```

## è·å–å½“å¤© date
```Python
datetime.date.today()
```

## è·å–æ˜å¤©/å‰Nå¤©
```Python
# æ˜å¤©
atetime.date.today() + datetime.timedelta(days=1)
# å‰Nå¤©
datetime.datetime.now()
datetime.datetime.now() - datetime.timedelta(days=3)
```

## è·å–å½“å¤©å¼€å§‹å’Œç»“æŸæ—¶é—´
```Python
datetime.datetime.combine(datetime.date.today(), datetime.time.min)
datetime.datetime.combine(datetime.date.today(), datetime.time.max)
```

## è·å–ä¸¤ä¸ª datetime çš„æ—¶é—´å·®
```Python
now = datetime.now()
end = datetime.strptime('2018-10-25 22:00','%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')
time = end - now
print(time.days,'å¤©')
```
## è·å–æœ¬å‘¨/æœ¬æœˆ/ä¸Šæœˆæœ€åä¸€å¤©

- æœ¬å‘¨æœ€åä¸€å¤©

```Python

today = datetime.date.today()
sunday = today + datetime.timedelta(6 - today.weekday())
sunday
```

- æœ¬æœˆæœ€åä¸€å¤©

```Python
import calendar
today = datetime.date.today()
last_day_num = calendar.monthrange(today.year, today.month)
last_day = datetime.date(today.year, today.month, last_day_num)
last_day
```

- ä¸Šæœˆæœ€åä¸€å¤©

```Python
import datetime
today = datetime.date.today()
first = datetime.date(day=1, month=today.month, year=today.year)
lastMonth = first - datetime.timedelta(days=1)
```
# è½¬æ¢
## datetime <=> string

- datetime -> string

```Python
import datetime
datetime.datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
```

- string -> datetime

```Python
import datetime
datetime.datetime.strptime("2018-10-22 12:50:46", "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
```

## datetime <=> timetuple

- datetime -> timetuple

```Python
import datetime
datetime.datetime.now().timetuple()
```

- timetuple -> datetime

```Python
timetuple => timestamp => datetime [çœ‹åé¢datetime<=>timestamp]
```

## datetime <=> date

- datetime -> date

```Python
import datetime
datetime.datetime.now().date()
```

- date -> datetime

```Python
datetime.date.today()
today = datetime.date.today()
datetime.datetime.combine(today, datetime.time())
datetime.datetime.combine(today, datetime.time.min)
```
## datetime <=> timestamp

- datetime -> timestamp

```Python
now = datetime.datetime.now()
timestamp = time.mktime(now.timetuple())
timestamp
```
## timestamp -> datetime
````Python
datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(1421077403.0)
```

```Python
    from selenium import webdriver
    from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
    from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys
    from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC
    from selenium.webdriver.support.wait import WebDriverWait

    #åˆ›å»ºChromeæµè§ˆå™¨å¯¹è±¡browser
    browser = webdriver.Chrome()
    try:
        #ç”¨getæ–¹å¼è®¿é—®ç™¾åº¦é¦–é¡µ
        browser.get('https://www.baidu.com')
        #é€šè¿‡idä¸ºâ€˜kwâ€™æ‰¾åˆ°è¾“å…¥æ¡†input
        input = browser.find_element_by_id('kw')
        #è°ƒç”¨è¯¥è¾“å…¥æ¡†çš„send_keysæ–¹æ³•å‘è¾“å…¥æ¡†é”®å…¥â€œPythonâ€å…³é”®è¯
        input.send_keys('Python')
        #é«˜ç”¨è¯¥è¾“å…¥æ¡†çš„send_keysæ–¹æ³•å‘è¾“å…¥æ¡†æŒ‰å›è½¦é”®
        input.send_keys(Keys.ENTER)
        #åˆ›å»ºæµè§ˆå™¨ç­‰å¾…å¯¹è±¡wait,ç­‰å¾…æ—¶é—´10ç§°
        wait = WebDriverWait(browser,10)
        #è°ƒç”¨waitçš„untilæ–¹æ³•ï¼Œç›´åˆ°IDä¸ºcontent_leftï¼ˆå³æœç´¢ç»“æœç•Œé¢ï¼‰å…ƒç´ å‡ºç°
        wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located((By.ID, 'content_left')))
        #æ‰“å°è¾“å‡ºæµè§ˆå™¨å½“å‰çš„URL
        print(browser.current_url)
        #æ‰“å°è¾“å‡ºå½“å‰çš„cookiesä¿¡æ¯
        print(browser.get_cookies)
        #æ‰“å°è¾“å‡ºç½‘é¡µæºä»£ç 
        print(browser.page_source)
    finally:
        #å…³é—­æµè§ˆå™¨
        browser.close()
```

    from selenium import webdriver
    from selenium.webdriver import ActionChains

    #åˆ›å»ºchromeæµè§ˆå™¨å¯¹è±¡browser
    browser = webdriver.Chrome()
    #è®¾ç½®urlä¸ºhttp://www.runoob.com/try/try.php?filename=jqueryui-api-droppable
    url = 'http://www.runoob.com/try/try.php?filename=jqueryui-api-droppable'
    #ç”¨getæ–¹å¼è®¿é—®ä»¥ä¸Šurl
    browser.get(url)
    #åœ¨æµè§ˆå™¨ä¸­åˆ‡æ¢å®šä½åˆ°åä¸ºiframeResultçš„frameå…ƒç´ 
    browser.switch_to.frame('iframeResult')
    #é€šè¿‡cssé€‰æ‹©å™¨æŸ¥æ‰¾idä¸ºdraggableçš„æ‹–æ›³æºï¼Œå¹¶å‘½åä¸ºsource
    source = browser.find_element_by_css_selector('#draggable')

    target = browser.find_element_by_css_selector('#droppable')
    #ç”¨ActionChainså‡½æ•°åˆ›å»ºæµè§ˆå™¨åŠ¨ä½œé“¾å¯¹è±¡actions
    actions = ActionChains(browser)
    #è°ƒç”¨actionsçš„drag_and_drop,è®¾è®¡å°†sourceæ”¾å…¥targetçš„åŠ¨ä½œ
    actions.drag_and_drop(source,target)
    #è°ƒç”¨performæ‰§è¡Œè¯¥åŠ¨ä½œ
    actions.perform()
    #å…³é—­æµè§ˆå™¨
    browser.close()
```

    # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*-
    # Author: Vitan
    with open('cp.txt','r') as f:
    content = f.read()

    # æ¸…æ´—æ•°æ®
    import string
    content = content.lower()  # æ ¼å¼åŒ–æ•°æ®ï¼Œè½¬ä¸ºå°å†™
    for i in string.punctuation:  # å»é™¤æ‰€æœ‰æ ‡ç‚¹ç¬¦å·
        content = content.replace(i, ' ')
    wordList = content.split()  # åˆ‡ç‰‡åˆ†è¯

    # æ’é™¤è¯­æ³•å‹è¯æ±‡ï¼Œä»£è¯ã€å† è¯ã€è¿è¯ç­‰æ— è¯­ä¹‰è¯
    noMean = {'a','an','the','i','do','am','you','no','t','m','d','ve'}
    wordSet = set(wordList) - noMean
    wordList = list(wordSet)

    # ç»Ÿè®¡å•è¯æ•°é‡
    data = {}
    for word in wordList:
    #data[word] = data.get(word, 0) + 1
        data[word] = wordList.count(word)

    for key in data:
        print(key,data[key],'æ¬¡')
    print("============")

    # list.sort() æ’åº
    wordList = list(data.items())
    # å‡½æ•°å®šä¹‰
    '''
    def takeSecond(elem): # å®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°ï¼Œè·å–æ¯ä¸ªå•è¯çš„æ¬¡æ•°é¡¹
    return elem[1]
    wordList.sort(key = takeSecond,reverse = True)
    '''
    # åŒ¿åå‡½æ•°
    wordList.sort(key = lambda x:x[1],reverse = True)
    print(wordList)
    print("============")

    # æ’åº
    hist = []
    for key, value in data.items():
        hist.append([value, key])
    hist.sort(reverse = True)  # é™åº

    # å‰20ä¸ª
    for i in range(20):
        print(hist[i])
```

    # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*-
    # Author: Vitan
    import jieba
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
    from  wordcloud import WordCloud

    # è¯»å–æ–‡ä»¶å†…å®¹
    with open('ch.txt','r',encoding = 'UTF-8') as f:
    content = f.read()

    # ç»“å·´åˆ†è¯
    wordList = jieba.cut(content)

    # è¯é¢‘ç»Ÿè®¡
    data = {}
    for word in wordList:
        if len(word)==1:
            continue
            else:data[word]=data.get(word,0)+1

    # åŒ¿åå‡½æ•°è·å–æ¯ä¸ªå•è¯çš„æ¬¡æ•°é¡¹ç»Ÿï¼Œé™åº
    result = list(data.items())
    result.sort(key=lambda x:x[1],reverse=True) # æ’åº
    for i in range(20):
        print(result[i])

    # è®¾ç½®è¯äº‘
    wordSplit = " ".join(dict(result))
    wc = WordCloud(background_color="black",  # è®¾ç½®èƒŒæ™¯é¢œè‰²
               # mask = "å›¾ç‰‡",  #è®¾ç½®èƒŒæ™¯å›¾ç‰‡
               max_words=2000,  # è®¾ç½®æœ€å¤§æ˜¾ç¤ºçš„å­—æ•°
               # stopwords = "", #è®¾ç½®åœç”¨è¯
               font_path="/usr/share/fonts/noto-cjk/NotoSansCJK-Medium.ttc",
               # è®¾ç½®ä¸­æ–‡å­—ä½“ï¼Œä½¿å¾—è¯äº‘å¯ä»¥æ˜¾ç¤ºï¼ˆè¯äº‘é»˜è®¤å­—ä½“æ˜¯â€œDroidSansMono.ttfå­—ä½“åº“â€ï¼Œä¸æ”¯æŒä¸­æ–‡ï¼‰
               max_font_size=50,  # è®¾ç½®å­—ä½“æœ€å¤§å€¼
               random_state=30,  # è®¾ç½®æœ‰å¤šå°‘ç§éšæœºç”ŸæˆçŠ¶æ€ï¼Œå³æœ‰å¤šå°‘ç§é…è‰²æ–¹æ¡ˆ
               )
    mywc = wc.generate(wordSplit)  # ç”Ÿæˆè¯äº‘

    # å±•ç¤ºè¯äº‘å›¾
    plt.imshow(mywc)
    plt.axis("off")
    plt.show()
    wc.to_file('mywor.png')  # ä¿å­˜å›¾ç‰‡æ–‡ä»¶

æœ€å¸¸è§„çš„åŒ¹é… ```Python import re content = 'Hello 123 4567 World_This is a Regex Demo' print(len(content)) #é€ä¸ªåŒ¹é…å•ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ result = re.match('^Hello\s\d\d\d\s\d{4}\s\w{10}.*Demo$',content) print(result) #è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸² print(result.group()) #è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…å­—ç¬¦é•¿åº¦ print(result.span()) ``` ## æ³›åŒ¹é… ```Python import re content = 'Hello 123 4567 World_This is a Regex Demo' #ç”¨.*ä»£è¡¨ä»»æ„ä¸ªä»»ä½•å­—ç¬¦ result = re.match('^Hello.*Demo$',content) #è¾“å‡ºæ•´ä¸ªåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ print(result) #è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸² print(result.group()) #è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…å­—ç¬¦é•¿åº¦ print(result.span()) ``` ## åŒ¹é…ç›®æ ‡ ```Python import re content = 'Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo' #ç”¨()åŒ¹é…ç›®æ ‡1234567 result = re.match('^Hello\s(\d+)\sWorld.*Demo$',content) print(result) print(result.group(1)) #è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…å­—ç¬¦é•¿åº¦ print(result.span()) ``` ## è´ªå©ªåŒ¹é… ```Python import re content = 'Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo' #ç”¨.*æ¨¡å¼å°è¯•åŒ¹é…æ•°å­—ä¸²1234567 result = re.match('^He.*\s(\d+)\sWorld.*Demo$',content) print(result) print(result.group(1)) ``` ## éè´ªå©ªåŒ¹é… ```Python import re content = 'Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo' #ç”¨.*ï¼Ÿæ¨¡å¼åŒ¹é…æ•°å­—ä¸²1234567 result = re.match('^H.*?\s(\d+)\sW.*?Demo$',content) print(result) print(result.group(1)) ``` ## åŒ¹é…æ¨¡å¼ ```Python import re content = '''Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo ''' #ç”¨re.Sæ„å‘³ç€.å¯ä»¥ä»£è¡¨æ¢è¡Œç¬¦åœ¨å†…çš„ç¬¦å· print(result.group(1))#è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…æ•°å­—ä¸² result = re.match('He.*?\s(\d+).*?Demo$',content,re.S) ``` # è½¬ä¹‰ ```Python import re content = 'price is $5.00' #ç›´æ¥ç”¨$ä¸.ä»£è¡¨åŸå­—ç¬¦ result = re.match('price is $5.00',content) print(result)#è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ ``` ```Python import re content = 'price is $5.00' #åŠ \ä»£è¡¨è½¬ä¹‰ result = re.match('price is \$5\.00',content) print(result)#è¾“å‡ºæ•´ä¸ªåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ ``` - æ€»ç»“ï¼šå°½é‡ä½¿ç”¨æ³›åŒ¹é…ã€ä½¿ç”¨æ‹¬å·å¾—åˆ°åŒ¹é…ç›®æ ‡ã€å°½é‡ä½¿ç”¨éè´ªå©ªæ¨¡å¼ã€æœ‰æ¢è¡Œç¬¦å°±ç”¨re.S # re.search re.search æ‰«ææ•´ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ä¸²å¹¶è¿”å›ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªæˆåŠŸçš„åŒ¹é…ã€‚ ```Python import re content = 'Extra stings Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo Extra stings' #ç”¨re.matchåŒ¹é…ä»¥Helloå¼€å¤´è‡³Demoçš„è¿™ä¸€æ®µå­—ç¬¦ä¸² result = re.match('Hello.*?(\d+).*?Demo$',content) print(result) ``` ```Python import re content = 'Extra stings Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo Extra stings' #ç”¨re.searchåŒ¹é…ä»¥Helloå¼€å¤´è‡³Demoçš„è¿™ä¸€æ®µå­—ç¬¦ä¸² result = re.search('Hello.*?(\d+).*?Demo', content) print(result)#è¾“å‡ºæ•´ä¸ªåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ print(result.group(1))#è¾“å‡ºæ•°å­—å­—ç¬¦ä¸² ``` - æ€»ç»“ï¼šä¸ºåŒ¹é…æ–¹ä¾¿ï¼Œèƒ½ç”¨ search å°±ä¸ç”¨ match # åŒ¹é…æ¼”ç»ƒ - ä¸€ ```Python import re html = '''

''' #åˆ†åˆ«åŒ¹é…é½ç§¦ï¼Œå¾€äº‹éšé£è¿™ä¸¤ä¸²ç›®æ ‡å­—ç¬¦ä¸² result = re.search('(\w+)',html,re.S) print(result.group(1),result.group(2)) ``` - äºŒ ```Python import re html = '''

  • å…‰è¾‰å²æœˆ
  • è®°äº‹æœ¬
  • ä½†æ„¿äººé•¿ä¹…
''' result = re.search('(\w+)',html,re.S) #åˆ†åˆ«åŒ¹é…ä»»è´¤é½ï¼Œæ²§æµ·ä¸€å£°ç¬‘è¿™ä¸¤ä¸²ç›®æ ‡å­—ç¬¦ä¸² print(result.group(1)) print(result.group(2)) #åŒæ—¶è¾“å‡ºä»»è´¤é½ï¼Œæ²§æµ·ä¸€å£°ç¬‘è¿™ä¸¤ä¸²ç›®æ ‡å­—ç¬¦ print(result.group(1),result.group(2)) ``` - ä¸‰ ```Python import re html = '''

ç»å…¸è€æ­Œåˆ—è¡¨

  • ä¸€è·¯ä¸Šæœ‰ä½

  • å…‰è¾‰å²æœˆ
  • è®°äº‹æœ¬
  • ä½†æ„¿äººé•¿ä¹…
''' result = re.search('(\w+)',html) #åˆ†åˆ«åŒ¹é…beyondï¼Œå…‰è¾‰å²æœˆè¿™ä¸¤ä¸²ç›®æ ‡å­—ç¬¦ä¸² print(result.group(1)) print(result.group(2)) #åŒæ—¶è¾“å‡ºbeyondï¼Œå…‰è¾‰å²æœˆè¿™ä¸¤ä¸²ç›®æ ‡å­—ç¬¦ä¸² print(result.group(1),result.group(2)) ``` # re.findall æœç´¢å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œä»¥åˆ—è¡¨å½¢å¼è¿”å›å…¨éƒ¨èƒ½åŒ¹é…çš„å­ä¸²ã€‚ ```Python import re html = '''

ç»å…¸è€æ­Œåˆ—è¡¨

''' #åŒ¹é…ä»ä»»è´¤é½å¼€å§‹æ‰€æœ‰æ­Œçš„href,singerå€¼ä¸æ–‡æœ¬å†…å®¹ result = re.findall('(\w+)',html,re.S) print(result)#è¾“å‡ºæ•´ä¸ªåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ print(type(result))#è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…ç»“æœçš„æ•°æ®ç±»å‹ #éå†æ‰€æœ‰åŒ¹é…ç»“æœï¼Œè¾“å‡ºæ¯ä¸€æ¡åŒ¹é…ç»“æœä¸æ¯ä¸€åŒ¹é…ç»“æœçš„ä¸‰ä¸ªå…ƒç´  for item in result : print(result) print(item[0],item[1],item[2]) ``` ```Python import re html = '''

ç»å…¸è€æ­Œ

ç»å…¸è€æ­Œåˆ—è¡¨

''' #ç”¨æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼åŒ¹é…ä»ä¸€è·¯ä¸Šæœ‰ä½ æ‰€åœ¨liæ ‡ç­¾å¼€å§‹çš„æ‰€æœ‰liæ ‡ç­¾ result = re.findall('\s*?()?(\w+)()?\s*?', html, re.S) print(result)#è¾“å‡ºæ•´ä¸ªåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ ##è¾“å‡ºæ¯ä¸€æ¡åŒ¹é…ç»“æœçš„ç¬¬2ä¸ªå…ƒç´  for item in result: print(item[1]) ``` # re.sub æ›¿æ¢å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ä¸­æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªåŒ¹é…çš„å­ä¸²åè¿”å›æ›¿æ¢åçš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ã€‚ ```Python import re content = 'Extra stings Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo Extra stings' #å°†æ•°å­—1234567æ›¿æ¢ä¸ºç©º content = re.sub('\d+','', content) print(content)#è¾“å‡ºæ›¿æ¢ç»“æœ ``` ```Python import re content = 'Extra stings Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo Extra stings' #å°†æ•°å­—1234567æ›¿æ¢ä¸ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²â€œReplacementâ€ content = re.sub('\d+','Replacement',content) print(content) ``` ```Python import re content = 'Extra stings Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo Extra stings' #å°†æ•°å­—1234567æ›¿æ¢ä¸º1234567 8910 content = re.sub('(\d+)', r'\1 8910', content) print(content)#è¾“å‡ºæ›¿æ¢ç»“æœ ``` ```Python import re html = '''

  • ä½†æ„¿äººé•¿ä¹…
''' #å»é™¤aç±»æ ‡ç­¾ï¼ˆç”¨re.subæ–¹æ³•æå–æ‰€æœ‰æ­Œåï¼Œæç¤ºæ€è·¯ï¼šå…ˆå»é™¤aç±»å‹æ ‡ç­¾ï¼Œå†ç”¨æ­£åˆ™æå–æ¯ä¸ªliæ ‡ç­¾çš„å†…å®¹ï¼‰ html = re.sub('|','',html) print(html)#è¾“å‡ºå»é™¤ç»“æœ #æ­£åˆ™åŒ¹é…liæ ‡ç­¾å†…å®¹ result = re.findall('li.*?>(.*?)',html,re.S) print(result) for item in result:#éå†æ¯ä¸€åŒ¹é…ç»“æœ print(item.strip())#è¾“å‡ºæ¯ä¸€åŒ¹é…ç»“æœå¹¶å»é™¤æ¢è¡Œç¬¦ ``` # re.compile 1. å°†æ­£åˆ™å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ç¼–è¯‘æˆæ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼å¯¹è±¡ 2. å°†ä¸€ä¸ªæ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼ä¸²ç¼–è¯‘æˆæ­£åˆ™å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œä»¥ä¾¿äºå¤ç”¨è¯¥åŒ¹é…æ¨¡å¼ ```Python import re content = '''Hello 1234567 World_This is a Regex Demo''' #ç¼–å†™Helloå¼€å§‹çš„è¿™ä¸€ä¸²å­—ç¬¦ä¸²åŒ¹é…æ¨¡å¼pattern pattern = re.compile('Hello.*?Demo',re.S) #ç”¨ä¸Šè¿°æ¨¡å¼åŒ¹é… result = re.match(pattern,content) #result = re.match('Hello.*Demo', content, re.S) print(result)#è¾“å‡ºåŒ¹é…ç»“æœ ``` # ç»ƒä¹ é¢˜ ```Python import requests import re content = requests.get('https://book.douban.com/').text pattern = re.compile('(.*?).*?year">(.*?).*?', re.S) #åˆ©ç”¨ä¸Šè¿°patternåŒ¹é…æ‰€æœ‰ä¹¦ç±çš„ä¸Šè¿°ä¿¡æ¯ results = re.findall(pattern, content) for result in results: #åˆ†åˆ«ç”¨url,title,author,dateä¸ºæ¯ä¸€ä¹¦ç±ä¿¡æ¯çš„å˜é‡å url, name, author, date = result #å°†authoråé¢çš„\næ›¿æ¢ä¸ºç©º author = re.sub('\s', '', author) #å°†dateåé¢çš„\næ›¿æ¢ä¸ºç©º date = re.sub('\s', '', date) #åŒæ—¶è¾“å‡ºæ¯ä¸€ä¹¦ç±url,title,author,dateä¿¡æ¯ print(url, name, author, date) ```

### å°†ä¸Šé¢è·å–åˆ°çš„å…¶ä¸­ä¸€æˆ¿æºçš„è¯¦ç»†å†…å®¹é¡µçš„ url è¿›è¡Œè¯·æ±‚å¹¶è§£ææå–ç›¸å…³æ•°æ®
```Python
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
# å°†ä»¥ä¸Šè·å¾—çš„ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªæˆ¿æºçš„è¯¦ç»†å†…å®¹é¡µè¿›è¡Œè¯·æ±‚è®¿é—®

# å¯¹å“åº”åŒ…resçš„ç½‘é¡µæ–‡æœ¬è¿›è¡Œè§£æï¼Œè§£æç»“æœå‘½åä¸ºsoup

#itemè¡¨ç¤ºåŒ…æ‹¬æˆ·å‹ï¼Œæœå‘ï¼Œå•ä»·ï¼Œæ¥¼å±‚ï¼Œè£…ä¿®ç­‰ç›¸å…³æ•°æ®çš„æ ‡ç­¾

### å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªè·å–ç½‘é¡µè¯¦ç»†å†…å®¹é¡µçš„å‡½æ•° getHouseDetail
```Python
def getHouseDetail(url):
    info={}
    info_adj={}
    # æ ¹æ®urlè¯·æ±‚ç½‘é¡µå†…å®¹
    res=requests.get(url)
    #è§£æè¯¦ç»†å†…å®¹é¡µï¼Œç»“æœå‘½åä¸ºsoup
    soup = BeautifulSoup(res.text,'html.parser')
    # è·å–æˆ¿å±‹åå¹¶åŠ å…¥infoå­—å…¸ï¼Œkeyå€¼å‘½åä¸ºâ€œæ ‡é¢˜
    info['æ ‡é¢˜']=soup.select('.title h1')[0].text.strip()
    # è·å–æˆ¿å±‹æ€»ä»·å¹¶åŠ å…¥infoå­—å…¸ï¼Œkeyå€¼å‘½åä¸ºâ€œæ€»ä»·
    info['æ€»ä»·']=soup.select('.price_esf')[0].text

    # ç”¨itemåšä¸ºå¾ªç¯å˜é‡åï¼Œä»£è¡¨å½“å‰ç½‘é¡µclassä¸ºtrl-item1çš„æ‰€æœ‰æ ‡ç­¾èŠ‚ç‚¹
    for item in soup.select('.trl-item1'):
        # keyè¡¨ç¤ºitemæ ‡ç­¾ä¸‹æ‰€æœ‰classä¸ºfont14çš„æ ‡ç­¾èŠ‚ç‚¹æ–‡æœ¬å†…å®¹
        key=item.select('.font14')[0].text.strip()
        print(key)
        # value ç¤ºitemæ ‡ç­¾ä¸‹æ‰€æœ‰classä¸ºttçš„æ ‡ç­¾èŠ‚ç‚¹æ–‡æœ¬å†…å®¹
        value=item.select('.tt')[0].text.strip()
        #å°†infoé‡Œé¢æ‰€æœ‰keyèµ‹å€¼ç»™value
        info[key]=value
        k=['æ€»ä»·','å•ä»·','å»ºç­‘é¢ç§¯','æœå‘','æ¥¼å±‚','è£…ä¿®','æˆ·å‹','æ ‡é¢˜']
    info_adj=dict(zip(k,list(info.values())))
    #print(info_adj)
    return info_adj
```
### é€šè¿‡è·å–æ‰€æœ‰æˆ¿å±‹çš„è¯¦ç»†å†…å®¹é¡µ urlï¼Œè·å–æ¯ä¸€æˆ¿å±‹çš„ç›¸å…³å­—æ®µä¿¡æ¯
```Python
getHouseDetail('http://esf.sh.fang.com/chushou/3_328597533.htm')

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
# å®šä¹‰åˆ—è¡¨ç”¨äºå­˜å‚¨æ‰€æœ‰æˆ¿å±‹çš„ç›¸å…³æ•°æ®
houseary=[]
# domain ä¸ºhttp://esf.sh.fang.comåŸŸå
domain='http://esf.sh.fang.com'
# è¯·æ±‚è®¿é—®http://esf.sh.fang.comé¦–é¡µï¼Œè·å¾—å“åº”åŒ…res
res=requests.get('http://esf.sh.fang.com')
#åˆ›å»ºBeatifulSoupå¯¹è±¡å¹¶è¿›è¡Œè§£æ
soup=BeautifulSoup(res.text,'html.parser')

# å¾ªç¯éå†è·å–ç½‘é¡µé¦–é¡µä¸­å­˜æœ‰çš„æ ‡ç­¾èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œå¾ªç¯å˜é‡å‘½åä¸ºlink
for link in soup.select('.shop_list dl dd h4 a'):
    # åˆ©ç”¨domainä¸å­˜å‚¨æˆ¿å±‹è¯¦ç»†å†…å®¹çš„ç›¸å¯¹urlçš„æ ‡ç­¾èŠ‚ç‚¹æ„å»ºæˆ¿å±‹çš„url
    url=domain+link['href']
    # è°ƒç”¨getHouseDetailå‡½æ•°è·å–æ¯ä¸€æˆ¿å±‹ç›¸å…³æ•°æ®å¹¶è¿½åŠ åˆ°houseary
    houseary.append(getHouseDetail(url))

#æ±‚æ€»å…±è·å–åˆ°å¤šå°‘å¥—æˆ¿å±‹ä¿¡æ¯
len(houseary)
```
### æ•°æ®å¤„ç†
```Python
import pandas
#å°†è·å–åˆ°çš„æ‰€æœ‰æˆ¿å±‹ä¿¡æ¯è½¬æ¢æˆæ•°æ®æ¡†çš„ç»“æ„
df = pandas.DataFrame(houseary)
df

#å­˜å‚¨åˆ°å½“å‰å·¥ä½œç©ºé—´ç›®å½•ä¸‹ï¼Œæ–‡ä»¶å‘½åä¸ºhouse.xlsx
df.to_excel('house.xlsx')

Python Numpy
